analyzed: de la ji ltar rtog pa thams cad rab tu med pa chos kyi sku gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa de lta bu'i sngags kyi lha la sogs pa 'byung zhes gang gis glengs na /
translated: In this regard, how can the mantra deities and so forth arise from the tathƒÅgata, who is the dharmakƒÅya, in which all conceptual thoughts are completely absent?

analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn has taught this:

analyzed: ji ltar lus kyi bye brag gi dmigs ston pa rnam pa mang du gnas pa de bzhin du sngags kyi mgon po gsungs pa grangs med pa'o //

original: ji ltar / yid bzhin nor bu dpal ldan pa ;
analyzed: ji ltar / yid bzhin nor bu dpal ldan pa ;

analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten sgron ma yi //

analyzed: ji ltar na yang gsang ba'i bdag po chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi rtog pa'i dgos pa thams cad mngon par byed ces pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po nam mkha'i khams ni sems can ma yin /

analyzed: 'dzin pa ma yin /

analyzed: bshad pa 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa shes pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis lha'i lus la sogs pa thams cad du rab tu snang ba de la rnam par rtog pa'i skabs kyis ci zhig bya zhes pa'o //

analyzed: tshul sna tshogs dang / bsam pa sna tshogs dang / thabs sna tshogs su 'chad pa de dag ji ltar mthong ba bcom ldan 'das la slar bzlas nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rgyu dang rtsa pa dang mthar thug pa dris pa la bya ste /

original: ji ltar bya zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig rnams 'dri ba la mi bya'i /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig rnams 'dri ba la mi bya'i /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu dang rtsa ba dang mthar thug pa dris pa'i tshig sbyor smos pa'o //

original: de la bcom ldan 'das dang de bzhin gshegs pa ni gong du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das dang de bzhin gshegs pa ni gong du bshad pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One and the Tathagata are as explained above.üîΩThe Arhat is the one who has destroyed the enemy of the defilements, or the one who is worthy of worship.üîΩHaving attained the knowledge of all things, the perfect Buddha,

original: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa'am bkur sti'i gnas su rigs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob nas zhes pa ni snying po byang chub na yang dag par bzhugs pa'o //

original: don dam par ni stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa'o //

original: so sor phye ste zhes pa ni so sor bshad pa'i don te /
analyzed: so sor phye ste zhes pa ni so sor bshad pa'i don te /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par ro gcig tu gyur cing rdzogs pa mtshan ni 'og nas 'chad /

original: mi dang lhar skye ba la sogs te /
analyzed: mi dang lhar skye ba la sogs te /

analyzed: gzhan yang mngon du dang nying nas nying gi rgyu dang rang bzhin par rig par ro //

translated: When bodhisattvas practice the bodhisattva activities, they spontaneously teach the accumulation of the accumulations of virtue in the gnosis of omniscience to sentient beings in various ways, such as in individual ways.

analyzed: de la tshul sna tshogs zhes pa ni /
translated: Various ways refers to

analyzed: de rnams su skye bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su mthun par chos 'chad pa la bya'o //

analyzed: thabs sna tshogs su 'chad ces pa ni /
translated: Various methods refers to

analyzed: de la sems can la la yang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba rnams kyi ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su mthong ngo zhes pa nas /

translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the conduct of each and every one‚Äù means that the Buddhas, the Disciples, and so on take on forms that are in accord with the conduct of those sentient beings who are to be disciplined by them, and that they appear in those forms.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de ni ro gcig ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de ni ro gcig ste /
translated: The gnosis of omniscience has one taste.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ro lags so zhes pa ni de ltar tshul sna tshogs dang / bsam pa dang thabs sna tshogs kyi sgo nas rnam pa tha dad pa du mar spros pa yang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ro lags so zhes pa ni de ltar tshul sna tshogs dang / bsam pa dang thabs sna tshogs kyi sgo nas rnam pa tha dad pa du mar spros pa yang /
translated: In this way, the various ways and the various intentions and methods are elaborated in many different ways.

original: spyi'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: spyi'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba /
translated: However, in general, the tathagatas' liberation

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa rtog pa'i bag chags kyi gnas las shin tu 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du ro gcig tu 'gyur ba ni /
translated: is of one taste in terms of its characteristic of being the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, which is utterly beyond the abode of the latent tendencies of conceptualization.

original: dper na bu ram shing rnam pa mang po'i khu ba las bu ram du byas na /
analyzed: dper na bu ram shing rnam pa mang po'i khu ba las bu ram du byas na /
translated: This is like, for example, when the juice of many sugarcane stalks is made into sugar,

original: de ni 'di lta ste dper na bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i khams ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba ste zhes pa nas de nas lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa la tshim par byed do zhes pa'i bar du ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'iüîΩrang @75a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste dper na bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i khams ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba ste zhes pa nas de nas lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa la tshim par byed do zhes pa'i bar du ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rang @75a * //
translated: The passage from the Bhagavan, the element of space is free from all conceptual thought up to then the world and its gods are satisfied is the praise of the result.üîΩüîΩ

original: bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ma lus pa'i bde ba thob pa'i pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa thob par bstan pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ma lus pa'i bde ba thob pa'i pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa thob par bstan pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, the space element is free from all conceptualization‚Äù up to ‚Äúthen it satisfies the world with its gods‚Äù teaches the perfection of the nature of that omniscient wisdom, the perfection of the object on the other side of manifest awakening, the perfection of abandonment, and the perfection of the object on the other side of attaining all forms of happiness.

original: dpe de dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis lhun gyis grub pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog mi dpyod par tshul sna tshogs la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi don bya ba byed par yang bstan pa ste
analyzed: dpe de dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis lhun gyis grub pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog mi dpyod par tshul sna tshogs la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi don bya ba byed par yang bstan pa ste
translated: These examples teach that omniscient wisdom is spontaneously present due to the power of previous aspirations, and that it acts for the welfare of sentient beings through various means without conceptualization or analysis.

original: / de la nam mkha'i dpes ni rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: / de la nam mkha'i dpes ni rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The example of space shows the perfection of nature.

original: nam mkha' ji ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i bag chags kyi gnas med pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la rtog pa med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ji ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i bag chags kyi gnas med pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la rtog pa med do //
translated: Just as space is not the abode of the habitual tendencies of speculation and investigation, so in that omniscient wisdom there is no speculation.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa med ces pa'i don to //
translated: It means that there is no discursive thought and no discursive investigation.

original: de la the tshom dogs pa de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: de la the tshom dogs pa de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: In that regard, there is no doubt that the omniscient wisdom is non-conceptual.

original: sems pa med na lus la sogs pa'i rgyun 'byung zhing sems can gyi don byed pa sems pa med par ji ltar 'byung zhing byed snyam pa la /
analyzed: sems pa med na lus la sogs pa'i rgyun 'byung zhing sems can gyi don byed pa sems pa med par ji ltar 'byung zhing byed snyam pa la /
translated: If there is no intention, how can the continuum of the body, etc. arise and how can the benefit of sentient beings be accomplished without intention?

original: sa'i dpes rnam par mi rtog bzhin du mngon par 'char ba'i pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa byed par bstan te /
analyzed: sa'i dpes rnam par mi rtog bzhin du mngon par 'char ba'i pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa byed par bstan te /
translated: The example of the earth shows the accomplishment of the benefit of others through the manifestation of non-conceptuality.

original: de las ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med bzhin rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dang me tog la sogs pas sems can thams cad kyi gsos su 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: de las ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med bzhin rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dang me tog la sogs pas sems can thams cad kyi gsos su 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: From that, without thought or discursive thought, it acts as the sustenance for all sentient beings through roots, fruits, flowers, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med bzhin sngags kyi lha la sogs pa'i sgor ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa med bzhin sngags kyi lha la sogs pa'i sgor ston te /
translated: Likewise, that omniscient wisdom, without thought or discursive thought, is shown through the door of the deity of mantra and so forth.

original: sems can rnams kyis kyang sngags kyi lha la sogs pa bsnyen cing bzlas pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mnyes par byas te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis kyang sngags kyi lha la sogs pa bsnyen cing bzlas pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mnyes par byas te /
translated: Sentient beings, by propitiating and reciting the deity of mantra and so forth, will please the deity.

original: mngon par 'char ba'i mtshan nyid mi dang lha'i longs spyod la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'char ba'i mtshan nyid mi dang lha'i longs spyod la sogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will obtain the characteristics of manifest appearance, such as human and divine enjoyments and so forth.

original: me'i dpes ni spong ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: me'i dpes ni spong ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The example of fire teaches the perfection of abandonment.

original: ji ltar mes rtsi shing la sogs pa thams cad bsregs kyang sreg par 'gyur ba'i mthu mi zad do //
analyzed: ji ltar mes rtsi shing la sogs pa thams cad bsregs kyang sreg par 'gyur ba'i mthu mi zad do //
translated: Just as fire burns all trees and so forth, the power of burning is inexhaustible.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang mi shes pa'i bud shing thams cad sreg pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang mi shes pa'i bud shing thams cad sreg pa ni //
translated: Likewise, that gnosis of omniscience burns all the fuel of non-knowledge.

original: rgyu'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rim gyis mi shes pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams @75b sel cing med par byed pa ni bud shing sreg pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rim gyis mi shes pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams @75b sel cing med par byed pa ni bud shing sreg pa'o //
translated: At the time of the cause, the bodhisattva deeds, the levels, the perfections, and so forth, gradually burn the fuel of non-knowledge and so forth, the factors of the afflictions that are incompatible with it.

original: gnyis su na 'bras bu'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi shes pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas na mi shes pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis su na 'bras bu'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi shes pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas na mi shes pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In another way, at the time of the result, omniscience itself has the nature of burning the fuel of non-knowledge, since it is characterized by the absence of non-knowledge.

original: rlung gi dpes kyang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa de nyid spong ba gong ma des kyang bag chags thams cad ma lus par spong ba'i dpe 'og mas bstan te /
analyzed: rlung gi dpes kyang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa de nyid spong ba gong ma des kyang bag chags thams cad ma lus par spong ba'i dpe 'og mas bstan te /
translated: The example of wind also illustrates the perfection of abandonment. The next example illustrates the complete abandonment of all habitual tendencies by the previous abandonment.

original: de bas na gsungs pa rlung gi khams ni rdul thams cad 'phyag go zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa rlung gi khams ni rdul thams cad 'phyag go zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThe wind element sweeps away all dust.‚Äù

original: de la rdul ni phra ba'i mtshan nyid de /üîΩde bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mi shes pa'i bag chags phra mo yan chad spangs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la rdul ni phra ba'i mtshan nyid de / de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mi shes pa'i bag chags phra mo yan chad spangs pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúparticle‚Äù is a characteristic of the subtle.üîΩLikewise, it should be understood as the abandonment of the subtle latent tendencies of ignorance up to the wisdom of omniscience.üîΩ

original: chu'i dpes ni ma lus pa'i bde ba'i pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /üîΩji ltar chu des tsha ba la sogs pas gdungs pa'i sems can gyi lus sim par byed pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang /
analyzed: chu'i dpes ni ma lus pa'i bde ba'i pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te / ji ltar chu des tsha ba la sogs pas gdungs pa'i sems can gyi lus sim par byed pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang /
translated: The example of water illustrates the perfection of the object of the highest bliss.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gdungs pa zhi bar byed pa ma lus pa'i bde ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa la sbyor zhing rdzogs pas na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gdungs pa zhi bar byed pa ma lus pa'i bde ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa la sbyor zhing rdzogs pas na /
translated: Just as that water cools the bodies of sentient beings tormented by heat and so on, likewise that gnosis of omniscience pacifies the torments of suffering and the afflictions of desire and so on of all sentient beings and connects them to nirvana, which is characterized by the bliss of being free of all suffering.

original: lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa la tshim par byed do zhes pa de dag ni /
analyzed: lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa la tshim par byed do zhes pa de dag ni /
translated: Since it perfects that, it is said to satisfy the world and its gods.

original: phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshul sngon chad bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa las /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshul sngon chad bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa las /
translated: Vajrapani himself says that the way of omniscience was previously taught by the Bhagavat.

original: bdag rang gi 'di ltar rtogs zhes gsol ba ste /
analyzed: bdag rang gi 'di ltar rtogs zhes gsol ba ste /
translated: He says, I myself have realized this.

original: bdag rang chung bar bstan pa dang chos 'chad pa spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rang chung bar bstan pa dang chos 'chad pa spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de dag gi rang bzhin de ltar chung mod kyi de dag gi rgyu gtso bo'i rgyu dang / rgyu'i rgyu dang / mthar rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu gang lags zhes dris pa /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin de ltar chung mod kyi de dag gi rgyu gtso bo'i rgyu dang / rgyu'i rgyu dang / mthar rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu gang lags zhes dris pa /
translated: Although their nature is like that, he asks, What is the primary cause of those, the causal cause, and the final completing cause?

original: de dag gi rgyu ni gang /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni gang /
translated: What is their cause?

original: rtsa ba ni gang /
analyzed: rtsa ba ni gang /
translated: What is the root?

original: mthar gyur pa ni gang zhes so //
analyzed: mthar gyur pa ni gang zhes so //
translated: What is the final one?

original: de la 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje tshul sna tshogs la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ro gcig par chud pa'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje tshul sna tshogs la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ro gcig par chud pa'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: There, the noble Vajrapani knows through the wisdom that enters into the single taste of the Tathagata's liberation, such as through the various methods,

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis shes /
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis shes /
translated: or through the wisdom of hearing.

original: de ste chud pa'i shes rab kyis shes na de bzhin gshegs pa dang khyad par med /
analyzed: de ste chud pa'i shes rab kyis shes na de bzhin gshegs pa dang khyad par med /
translated: If one understands by the wisdom of comprehension, one is no different from a Tathagata.

original: thos pa'i shes rab kyis chud na sems can phal dang 'dra bar dogs pa la lan du bya ba /
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab kyis chud na sems can phal dang 'dra bar dogs pa la lan du bya ba /
translated: If one understands by the wisdom of hearing, one is like an ordinary being.

original: shes rab de gnyis kas shes pa la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: shes rab de gnyis kas shes pa la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in understanding by either of these two wisdoms.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sku mi zad pa'i rgyan la sogs par @76a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sku mi zad pa'i rgyan la sogs par @76a * //
translated: The Bhagavat has said in the Aksayamatinirdesa and so on that

original: 'jug pa rang gi mthu ji tsam pa'i spyod yul chud kyi /
analyzed: 'jug pa rang gi mthu ji tsam pa'i spyod yul chud kyi /
translated: one understands the sphere of activity to the extent of one's own power.

original: bcom ldan 'das ltar rnam pa thams cad du chud pa ni ma yin te khyad par med par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ltar rnam pa thams cad du chud pa ni ma yin te khyad par med par mi 'gyur /

original: thos pa yang chud pa gtso bo yin par gyur gyi /
analyzed: thos pa yang chud pa gtso bo yin par gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, understanding by hearing is the most important thing.

original: sems can phal ltar thos pa tsam gtsor gyur ba ma yin pas sems can phal dang khyad par med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can phal ltar thos pa tsam gtsor gyur ba ma yin pas sems can phal dang khyad par med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But one is not the same as an ordinary being, for whom hearing is the most important thing.

original: gnyis su ni chud pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad chud pa la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: gnyis su ni chud pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad chud pa la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in understanding in both ways, for

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyi rlabs kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul rnam pa thams cad du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyi rlabs kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul rnam pa thams cad du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the BhagavƒÅn, through his blessing, knows the minds of others, in the same way, he completely penetrates the domain of omniscient wisdom in all its aspects.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rgyu dang rtsa ba dang mthar gyur pa dris pa la /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de'i rgyu dang rtsa ba dang mthar gyur pa dris pa la /
translated: There, VajrapƒÅ·πái asked the BhagavƒÅn about the cause, root, and culmination of that omniscient wisdom.

original: dge'o dge'o tshig lan gsum gsungs pa /
analyzed: dge'o dge'o tshig lan gsum gsungs pa /
translated: He said virtuous, virtuous three times.

original: gong ma gnyis ni dris pa'i dngos po bzang bas mnyes te /
analyzed: gong ma gnyis ni dris pa'i dngos po bzang bas mnyes te /
translated: The first two are pleased because the matter of the question is good.

original: bstod pa'i tshig tu lan gnyis bzlas pa ni dris pa'i tshig de nyid dge ba la bya /
analyzed: bstod pa'i tshig tu lan gnyis bzlas pa ni dris pa'i tshig de nyid dge ba la bya /
translated: The repetition of the word praise twice is for the virtuous question itself.

original: 'og ma gcig ni phyag na rdo rje la bya ste /
analyzed: 'og ma gcig ni phyag na rdo rje la bya ste /
translated: The last one is for VajrapƒÅ·πái.

original: de lta bu'i don bzang po 'dri zhing sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir dris pa dge'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don bzang po 'dri zhing sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir dris pa dge'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said, The question for the sake of such good meaning and for the benefit of sentient beings is virtuous.

original: dge bar nyon la shin tu yid la zung shig ces pas snod bzhi las bzlog par gsungs te /
analyzed: dge bar nyon la shin tu yid la zung shig ces pas snod bzhi las bzlog par gsungs te /
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind well is said in contrast to the four vessels.

original: nyon cig ces pa ni snod khas phub pa las bzlog pa'o //üîΩdge bar zhes pa ni snod gyo mo las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon cig ces pa ni snod khas phub pa las bzlog pa'o // dge bar zhes pa ni snod gyo mo las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Listen! This is the opposite of a vessel that is turned upside down.üîΩBe virtuous! This is the opposite of a vessel that is cracked.

original: shin tu zhes pa ni snod mi gtsang bas gang ba las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu zhes pa ni snod mi gtsang bas gang ba las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Very! This is the opposite of a vessel that is filled with impure substances.

original: yid la zung shig ces pas ni snod zhabs rdol las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yid la zung shig ces pas ni snod zhabs rdol las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Keep it in mind! This is the opposite of a vessel that is leaky.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is the thought of awakening.

original: snying rje ni rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni rtsa ba'o //
translated: Compassion is the root.üîΩSkill in means is the culmination.

original: thabs ni mthar gyur pa zhes pa la de la byang chub kyi sems la yang rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩbyang chub kyi phyir sems dpa' dang byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems so //
analyzed: thabs ni mthar gyur pa zhes pa la de la byang chub kyi sems la yang rnam pa gnyis te / byang chub kyi phyir sems dpa' dang byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems so //
translated: Therein, the thought of awakening is twofold:üîΩthe hero for the sake of awakening, and the thought of the nature of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi phyir sems dpa' ni smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems dag kyang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir sems dpa' ni smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems dag kyang yin mod kyi /
translated: The hero for the sake of awakening is the thought of aspiration and the thought of engagement.

original: skabs 'dir sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems la bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems la bya ste /
translated: But in this context, the thought of awakening of the first stage is meant,

original: sa dang po'i sems de mngon par byang chub pa'i snying por sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang po'i sems de mngon par byang chub pa'i snying por sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that thought of the first stage is applied to the site of perfect awakening.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of enlightenment is also like this.

original: sa dang po byang chub kyi sems de ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du chud pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sa dang po byang chub kyi sems de ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du chud pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The enlightenment mind of the first stage is the nature of all phenomena being subsumed in equality,

original: mngon par byang chub pa dang rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa dang rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is of the same nature as manifest enlightenment.

original: de lta bu'i @76b byang chub kyi sems ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu'i gtso bor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i @76b byang chub kyi sems ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu'i gtso bor rig par bya'o //
translated: Such an enlightenment mind should be known as the primary cause of omniscient wisdom.

original: snying rje ni rtsa ba ste sems can sdug bsngal bas gdungs pa las bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje ni rtsa ba ste sems can sdug bsngal bas gdungs pa las bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Compassion is the root, because it is the antidote to being tormented by the suffering of sentient beings.

original: snying rje'i sgo nas smon lam la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems skye ste /
analyzed: snying rje'i sgo nas smon lam la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems skye ste /
translated: Through compassion, the enlightenment mind of aspiration and so forth arises.

original: de bas na snying rje chan po byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa bar gyur pas na rgyu'i yang rgyur blta'o //
analyzed: de bas na snying rje chan po byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa bar gyur pas na rgyu'i yang rgyur blta'o //
translated: Therefore, since great compassion is the root of the enlightenment mind, it is seen as the cause of the cause.

original: gnyis su na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brtan par gnas pa'i phyir rtsa ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brtan par gnas pa'i phyir rtsa ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, it is called the root because it firmly abides as the cause of omniscient wisdom.

original: thugs rje'i gzungs kyis lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las mi 'da' bar dus thams cad du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gnas shing /
analyzed: thugs rje'i gzungs kyis lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las mi 'da' bar dus thams cad du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gnas shing /
translated: By the power of compassion, they do not pass into the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is the exhaustion of the aggregates, but remain in the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is not a place of dwelling.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ye shes brtan pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ye shes brtan pa ste /
translated: They are stable in the wisdom of the relative and the ultimate.

original: sdong po'i rtsa ba ltar brtan par byed pa bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: sdong po'i rtsa ba ltar brtan par byed pa bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: They are the root of the wisdom of omniscience, like the root of a tree.

original: thabs ni mthar gyur zhes pa las /
analyzed: thabs ni mthar gyur zhes pa las /
translated: As for the method, it is the ultimate method.

original: thabs ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par sbyor ba'i mtha' de dag gis brtan pas na mthar gyur par blta'o //
analyzed: thabs ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par sbyor ba'i mtha' de dag gis brtan pas na mthar gyur par blta'o //
translated: The method is the perfection of generosity and so forth. It is the ultimate method because it is stable through the completion of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi sems so zhes bya ba byang chub nyid gang yin mi shes pa bstan pa gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la byang chub gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi sems so zhes bya ba byang chub nyid gang yin mi shes pa bstan pa gsang ba pa'i bdag po de la byang chub gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: As for the cause of omniscience being bodhicitta, since it is not known what enlightenment is, the Lord of Secrets said, ‚ÄúWhat is enlightenment?‚Äù

original: 'di ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs pa'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the characteristic of space.

original: gong du byang chub kyi sems thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur bshad pa de'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin bshad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gong du byang chub kyi sems thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur bshad pa de'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin bshad pa la bya ste /
translated: The above explains that the thought of awakening is the cause of the gnosis of omniscience.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de la byang chub gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de la byang chub gang zhe na /
translated: Lord of Secrets, what is awakening?üîΩIt is the knowledge of one‚Äôs own mind just as it is.

original: rang gi sems nyid ji lta ba nyid du shes pa zhes pa la gang zhe na zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i byang chub rnams las gang yin zhes pa la mi bya'i byang chub de ci 'dra ba zhes pa la
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid ji lta ba nyid du shes pa zhes pa la gang zhe na zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i byang chub rnams las gang yin zhes pa la mi bya'i byang chub de ci 'dra ba zhes pa la
translated: What is that? It is not asking, ‚ÄúAmong the awakenings of the hearers, solitary realizers, and the Great Vehicle, which is it?‚Äù It is asking, ‚ÄúWhat is that awakening like?‚Äù

original: bya'o // rang gi sems ji lta ba nyid du shes pa ni sbyor ba'i sems kyis bum pa la sogs pa ji bzhin par mthong ba de skad cig ma phyi ma'i sems kyi bum pa la sogs pa'i ji bzhin pa de yang dag pa ma yin par sun phyung nas
analyzed: bya'o // rang gi sems ji lta ba nyid du shes pa ni sbyor ba'i sems kyis bum pa la sogs pa ji bzhin par mthong ba de skad cig ma phyi ma'i sems kyi bum pa la sogs pa'i ji bzhin pa de yang dag pa ma yin par sun phyung nas
translated: The knowledge of one‚Äôs own mind just as it is is the mind of application seeing a vase and so on just as it is. The mind of the subsequent moment refutes the vase and so on just as it is, as not being real.

original: de ltar gzung ba'i cha sun phyung ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba'i cha sun phyung ste /
translated: Thus, the aspect of the object is refuted.

original: med na 'dzin pa'i cha yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med na 'dzin pa'i cha yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it does not exist, the aspect of the subject does not exist either.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yongs su dag par ji bzhin med par rang bzhin gyis dag par shes pa ni rang gi sems yang dag par ji lta ba nyid du shes pa'o //üîΩde bzhin du gzhung @77a * //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yongs su dag par ji bzhin med par rang bzhin gyis dag par shes pa ni rang gi sems yang dag par ji lta ba nyid du shes pa'o // de bzhin du gzhung @77a * //
translated: Thus, the knowledge that the mind is pure, as it is, without any nature of subject or object, is the knowledge of one's own mind as it is.

original: gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang /
translated: In the same way, in other scriptures,

original: ye shes bzhi las mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni byang chub kyi sems su bshad /
analyzed: ye shes bzhi las mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni byang chub kyi sems su bshad /
translated: the wisdom of equality among the four wisdoms is explained as the mind of enlightenment.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su bshad par rig par bya'o //üîΩde ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po zhes pa la /

analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i bag chags yan chad ma lus par spangs pas na kun du byang chub pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gnyis su na rang gi sems ji lta ba nyid kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du stong par shes par bya'o //

translated: Enlightenment has the characteristic of space means that, although it is indeed the characteristic of space, which is permanent, unchanging, empty, and so forth,

analyzed: byang chub de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: chos thams cad kyang mtshan ma med de nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa'o //

analyzed: de la chos ni sems las gzhan pa'i phung po la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: 'di lta ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni nam mkha' la mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Then VajrapƒÅ·πái said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang nas btsal bar bgyi /

original: byang chub mngon par rdzogs pa yang gang nas btsal bar bgyi zhes pa nas /
analyzed: byang chub mngon par rdzogs pa yang gang nas btsal bar bgyi zhes pa nas /
translated: From where should one seek the complete realization of enlightenment?

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba chos snang ba'i sgo mo ste chos snang ba'i tshul dang po'o zhes pa'i bar du /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ; byang chub mngon par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi rnam par dag pa'i sgo zhes bya ba chos snang ba'i sgo mo ste chos snang ba'i tshul dang po'o zhes pa'i bar du / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ; byang chub mngon par rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: 'jug pa'i thabs dris pa dang / de gnyis rang gi sems las btsal ba'i thabs bstan pa la bya'o //

analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs pa gang nas btsal zhes pa ni de la ji ltar 'jug ces dris pa'o //

translated: Not blue in color, up to not the color of crystal means that the mind is not an object seen as a color.

analyzed: thung du ma yin zhes pa nas ma ning du yang ma yin zhes pa'i bar du dbyibs ji bzhin par ma yin pa la bya'o //

analyzed: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang zhes pa nas sems can gyi ris mthun pa'i rang bzhin ma yin zhes pa'i bar du rgyud ji bzhin mthong ba med pa la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot the nature of gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as‚Äù up to ‚Äúnot the nature of the various types of sentient beings‚Äù means that it is not seen as the nature of the mind-stream.

original: sems ni mig la'ang mi gnas zhes pa nas yid la mi gnas zhes pa'i bar du dbang po drug la sems gnas par mthong ba med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sems ni mig la'ang mi gnas zhes pa nas yid la mi gnas zhes pa'i bar du dbang po drug la sems gnas par mthong ba med pa la bya'o //

analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa de rnams kyi ji bzhin par snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance of those colors, shapes, and so on as they areüîΩis the appearance of the mind.

analyzed: de bas na dri ma de dag thams cad yongs su dag pa'i sems de ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Hence, it is said:

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: sems ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The mind has the characteristic of space.

analyzed: zhes pa ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa @78b spangs pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of space is the abandonment of thought and discursive thought.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de dang 'dra ba'i phyir gsungs pa de bas na rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de dang 'dra ba'i phyir gsungs pa de bas na rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes pa ste /

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa spangs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means the abandonment of discursive thought and investigation.

analyzed: de ltar sems ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid dang 'dra bas byang chub kyang de yin /

original: de ni snying rje'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas zin pa'o zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sems rang bzhin gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyang med pa byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid de'i rtsa ba ni snying rje ste brtan par

translated: The root of such a mind, which is free from the habitual tendencies of apprehended object and apprehending subject, is compassion, which stabilizes it.

original: byed pa'o // de la sbyor bar byed pa'i thabs ni pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa'o // de la sbyor bar byed pa'i thabs ni pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

original: gzhan yang gsang ba'i bdag po sgrib pa thams cad spong pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sngar thob nas thob pa tsam du ma zad kyi ting nge 'dzin nyid dang ldan par gnas pa
analyzed: gzhan yang gsang ba'i bdag po sgrib pa thams cad spong pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sngar thob nas thob pa tsam du ma zad kyi ting nge 'dzin nyid dang ldan par gnas pa
translated: Moreover, O Lord of Secrets, the bodhisattva who abides in this meditative absorption that eliminates all obscurations, having attained such a meditative absorption, does not merely attain it, but abides in possession of the meditative absorption itself.

original: la bya'o // shin tu dad pa'i mthus sangs rgyas kyi chos nyon mi mongs par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rab tu spangs pa /

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems byang chub kyi mtshan nyid de lta bu la lhag par mos pa'i mthus bsags pas sangs rgyas kyi chos chud pa dang / lugs kyi mtshan nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang / sku'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i chos rnams ma bsgrubs kyang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems byang chub kyi mtshan nyid de lta bu la lhag par mos pa'i mthus bsags pas sangs rgyas kyi chos chud pa dang / lugs kyi mtshan nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang / sku'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i chos rnams ma bsgrubs kyang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Through the power of having accumulated merit by having superior devotion to the mind that is naturally luminous, which is the characteristic of enlightenment, one will obtain the qualities of a buddha, the characteristics of the system, the perfections, and so forth, and the Dharmas of the wheel of the body, and so forth, without having to practice them.

original: mdor na gsang ba'i bdag po rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: mdor na gsang ba'i bdag po rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang yang rung ste /
translated: In brief, O Lord of Secrets, any son or daughter of good family

analyzed: de ni yon tan tshang med pa dang ldan par 'gyur te zhes pa ni /

analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi so so'i yon tan brjod na bskal par yang mi rdzogs te /
translated: The qualities of those sons or daughters of good family who are endowed with such samƒÅdhis, if described, would not be completed even in an eon.

original: brjod kyis mi lang bas tshad 'di tsam mo zhes gzung du med de /
analyzed: brjod kyis mi lang bas tshad 'di tsam mo zhes gzung du med de /
translated: Since they are inexpressible, they cannot be apprehended as being of this or that measure.

original: mdor smras pa tshad med pa'i yon tan dang ldan no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mdor smras pa tshad med pa'i yon tan dang ldan no zhes pa'o //
translated: In brief, it is said that they are endowed with immeasurable qualities.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
translated: Then again, Vajrapani said to the bhagavat...

original: thub pa chen pos bshad du gsol //
analyzed: thub pa chen pos bshad du gsol //
translated: ...the great sage, please explain.üîΩ...

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni gong du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu dang byang chub sems kyi mtshan nyid zhib tu bshad de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni gong du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu dang byang chub sems kyi mtshan nyid zhib tu bshad de /

original: byang chub kyi sems de lta bu la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i yon tan gyi tshad kyang tshad med pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa zhes gsungs te /

translated: The qualities of attaining samadhi by abiding in such bodhichitta are said to be endowed with immeasurable qualities.üîΩ...how does bodhichitta arise?üîΩ...what are the characteristics of bodhichitta?

original: de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / byang chub kyi sems de'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra bar shes bar bya ba la sogs pa dris pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / byang chub kyi sems de'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra bar shes bar bya ba la sogs pa dris pa ste /
translated: ...and so forth.üîΩ...how does the bhagavat generate bodhichitta?

original: de ji ltar sems na bcom ldan 'das byang chub tu ni skye zhes bgyi zhes pa ni spyir na skyes zhes pa dang / skye zhes bgyi zhes pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ji ltar sems na bcom ldan 'das byang chub tu ni skye zhes bgyi zhes pa ni spyir na skyes zhes pa dang / skye zhes bgyi zhes pa gnyis te /
translated: How is it that the Transcendent Lord is born into enlightenment?üîΩ

original: de la skye zhes pa ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: de la skye zhes pa ni ming tsam ste /
translated: The word arises is merely a name.

original: dper na bu mngal du zhugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu mngal du zhugs pa lta bu'o //

original: skye zhes bgyi zhes pa ni skyes par gdags pa'i don to //
analyzed: skye zhes bgyi zhes pa ni skyes par gdags pa'i don to //

original: dper na bu btsas pa dngos lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu btsas pa dngos lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like an actual birth of a son.

original: de bas na @81a * //
analyzed: de bas na @81a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub kyi sems skye ba tsam dris pa ma yin gyis dang po'i sems byang chub kyi mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs par skyes pa dris pa la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems skye ba tsam dris pa ma yin gyis dang po'i sems byang chub kyi mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs par skyes pa dris pa la bya'o //
translated: it is not merely asking about the mere arising of the thought of awakening, but it should be understood as asking about the arising of the thought of the first ground, which is the complete characteristic of awakening.

original: byang chub tu zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi phyir skye ba la bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi phyir skye ba la bya ste /
translated: The word awakening refers to the arising for the sake of unsurpassed awakening.

original: de yang sa dang po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub dang rang bzhin gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sa dang po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub dang rang bzhin gcig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of the thought of the first ground is of the same nature as unsurpassed awakening.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la sogs pa rim gyis rdzogs par byed pa yang rang bzhin de la tha dad pa ma yin gyi rang bzhin de nyid las /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la sogs pa rim gyis rdzogs par byed pa yang rang bzhin de la tha dad pa ma yin gyi rang bzhin de nyid las /
translated: Also, the gradual perfection of unsurpassed awakening and so on is not different in nature from that nature.

original: mi mthun pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa sel pa'i sgo nas ming gzhan du btags pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa sel pa'i sgo nas ming gzhan du btags pa tsam du zad do //
translated: It is merely a different name given in order to eliminate the discordant factors and so on.

original: dper na gser nyid las rgyan la sogs par byas na rang bzhin gcig kyang ming gi rnam grangs mang por thogs pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na gser nyid las rgyan la sogs par byas na rang bzhin gcig kyang ming gi rnam grangs mang por thogs pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, when gold is made into ornaments and so on, although it is of one nature, it is given many different names.

original: de bas na sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de byang chub kyi rang bzhin la yang bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de byang chub kyi rang bzhin la yang bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the bodhicitta of the first ground is also called bodhicitta.

original: smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems kyang byang chub kyi phyir sems pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems kyang byang chub kyi phyir sems pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the aspiration and engaged bodhicittas are indeed minds that think of enlightenment,

analyzed: sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub dang rang bzhin mi gcig pas de la mi bya'o //
translated: they are not called bodhicitta because they are not of the same nature as the unsurpassed enlightenment, unlike the bodhicitta of the first ground.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na lan bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na lan bka' stsal pa /
translated: In another way, the answer is given:

original: byang chub kyi sa dang po'i mtshan nyid gsungs pas na gzhan ma yin par mngon no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sa dang po'i mtshan nyid gsungs pas na gzhan ma yin par mngon no //
translated: Since the characteristics of the first ground of enlightenment are taught, it is clear that it is not something else.

original: ji ltar na mtshan nyid shes par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar na mtshan nyid shes par bgyi /
translated: How is its characteristic to be known?

original: byang chub 'byung ba skyes pa'i sems //
analyzed: byang chub 'byung ba skyes pa'i sems //
translated: The mind that has given rise to the arising of enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de las bla na med pa'i byang chub 'byung bas de ni byang chub 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de las bla na med pa'i byang chub 'byung bas de ni byang chub 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the enlightenment mind of the first stage, and since unsurpassed enlightenment arises from it, it is called the source of enlightenment.

original: byang chub 'byung pa'i sems de skyes pa'i mtshan nyid bsod nams chen po'i snying po nam mkha' bzhin du tshad med pa la sogs pa dris pa la bya'o//
analyzed: byang chub 'byung pa'i sems de skyes pa'i mtshan nyid bsod nams chen po'i snying po nam mkha' bzhin du tshad med pa la sogs pa dris pa la bya'o//
translated: The question is about the nature of the arising of that enlightenment mind, which is the immeasurable essence of great merit, like space.

original: sems rig pa'i mchog ye shes 'byung bas gsungs zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das la yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sems rig pa'i mchog ye shes 'byung bas gsungs zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das la yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa la bya ste /
translated: The statement that it is taught by the one who is the source of pristine awareness, the supreme knower of minds, is a praise of the Lord in terms of his qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su sems rig pa mchog gi phyir bya ba dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes las byung bas ye shes 'byung zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su sems rig pa mchog gi phyir bya ba dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes las byung bas ye shes 'byung zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Lord is the source of pristine awareness because the emanation body and the beatific body arise from the pristine awareness of omniscience, and because the Lord is the supreme knower of minds in the world, among the disciples, and among the self-realized Buddhas.üîΩThe great hero, after passing beyond

original: dpa' bo chen po ji snyed cig / shin tu 'das nas gdod skye ba //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po ji snyed cig / shin tu 'das nas gdod skye ba //
translated: all the stages, is born.

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sems grangs du zhig 'das nas byang chub kyi sems de skye ba dris pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sems grangs du zhig 'das nas byang chub kyi sems de skye ba dris pa ste /
translated: This is the question about how many mundane thoughts there are before the thought of enlightenment arises.

original: sems brgya drug cu po 'das nas skye ba la bya ste /
analyzed: sems brgya drug cu po 'das nas skye ba la bya ste /
translated: It is to be understood that it arises after one hundred and sixty thoughts.

original: @81b sems skyes zhes pa ma yin gyi skye btsam la bya'o //
analyzed: @81b sems skyes zhes pa ma yin gyi skye btsam la bya'o //
translated: It is not that the thought of enlightenment has arisen, but that it is just about to arise.

original: mgon po sems rnams mtshan nyid dang // dus kyang rgyas par bshad du gsol //
analyzed: mgon po sems rnams mtshan nyid dang // dus kyang rgyas par bshad du gsol //
translated: The protector has explained the characteristics of the thoughts, and the time as well.

original: zhes pa ni sems brgya drug cu po de dag gi mtshan nyid 'dod chags kyi sems zhe sdang gi sems zhes pa la sogs pa dang / sems brgya drug cu po de dag 'das nas kyang bskal pa la sogs pa ji srid cig na byang chub kyi sems de skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i dus dris pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems brgya drug cu po de dag gi mtshan nyid 'dod chags kyi sems zhe sdang gi sems zhes pa la sogs pa dang / sems brgya drug cu po de dag 'das nas kyang bskal pa la sogs pa ji srid cig na byang chub kyi sems de skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i dus dris pa'o //
translated: This is the question about the characteristics of those one hundred and sixty thoughts, such as the thought of passion, the thought of hatred, etc., and the time after those one hundred and sixty thoughts, after how many eons, etc., the thought of enlightenment will arise.

original: de'i bsod nams ci 'dra ba dang spyod pa ci 'dra ba zhig ces pa ni de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems skyes pa de'i bsod nams ji lta bu dang / spyod pa ci 'dra ba zhig spyad pas na byang chub kyi sems de thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams ci 'dra ba dang spyod pa ci 'dra ba zhig ces pa ni de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems skyes pa de'i bsod nams ji lta bu dang / spyod pa ci 'dra ba zhig spyad pas na byang chub kyi sems de thob ces pa'o //
translated: This is asking, ‚ÄúWhat is the merit of giving rise to such an awakening mind, and what kind of conduct is practiced so that one attains that awakening mind?‚Äù

original: sems la sems kyi khyad par yang //
analyzed: sems la sems kyi khyad par yang //
translated: The mind and the distinction of mind

original: theg pa chen po bshad du gsol //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bshad du gsol //
translated: Please explain the Great Vehicle.

original: zhes pa ni sems can dbang po rnon po chos la bdag med par rtogs nas 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa dbang po rtul po rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i sa brgyad bsgoms nas 'jug pa'i khyad par dris pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems can dbang po rnon po chos la bdag med par rtogs nas 'jug pa dang / 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa dbang po rtul po rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i sa brgyad bsgoms nas 'jug pa'i khyad par dris pa la bya'o //
translated: This is asking about the distinction of engaging in the Great Vehicle by means of the sharp faculties of sentient beings who realize the selflessness of phenomena, and engaging in the eight levels of the noble hearers and so forth by means of the dull faculties.

original: de la sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems spyir bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems spyir bya'o //
translated: In this context, ‚Äúmind‚Äù should be taken as the general term for the awakening mind.

original: de nas rnam par snang mdzad kyis zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas rnam par snang mdzad kyis zhes pa nas /
translated: Then Vairocana‚Ä¶

original: byang chub dang po zhes kyang bya //
analyzed: byang chub dang po zhes kyang bya //
translated: It is also called the first awakening.

original: zhes pa'i bar du gong du phyag na rdo rjes dris pa'i lan bka' stsal pa la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du gong du phyag na rdo rjes dris pa'i lan bka' stsal pa la bya ste /
translated: The passage up to ‚Äúthus have I heard‚Äù is the reply to Vajrapani‚Äôs question above.

original: bu khyod ces pa ni phyag na rdo rje chos kyi dbyings las skyes pas na bcom ldan 'das kyi sras so //
analyzed: bu khyod ces pa ni phyag na rdo rje chos kyi dbyings las skyes pas na bcom ldan 'das kyi sras so //
translated: ‚ÄúSon‚Äù refers to Vajrapani, who is the son of the Lord because he is born from the ultimate realm.

original: chen po 'byung ba zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: chen po 'byung ba zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat source‚Äù refers to the character of the mind continuum.

original: sems kyi rgyud de las byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes chen po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud de las byang chub dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes chen po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the great enlightenment and omniscient wisdom arise from that mind continuum.

original: dge'o zhes pa ni de lta bu'i don bzang po dris pa nyid dge ba dang phyag na rdo rje dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: dge'o zhes pa ni de lta bu'i don bzang po dris pa nyid dge ba dang phyag na rdo rje dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúExcellent‚Äù is stated in order to generate joy in Vajrapani because the question about such an excellent meaning is itself excellent.

original: theg chen gnas ni mchog yin zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyud de /
analyzed: theg chen gnas ni mchog yin zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyud de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe supreme abode of the Great Vehicle‚Äù refers to the mind continuum.

original: theg pa gsum gyi nang na mchog dam pa la bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi nang na mchog dam pa la bya'o //
translated: Among the three vehicles, it is the supreme, the highest.

original: sems kyi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bshad kyis nyon cig pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sems kyi mtshan nyid bshad kyis nyon cig pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the statement: Listen to the explanation of the characteristic of the mind endowed with such special qualities.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsang mchog ces pa ni de lta bu'i sems rnam par dag pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin te /üîΩsems can phal gyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / snod ma yin pa la mi bstan pa'i phyir gsang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsang mchog ces pa ni de lta bu'i sems rnam par dag pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin te / sems can phal gyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / snod ma yin pa la mi bstan pa'i phyir gsang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The supreme secret of the Buddhas is the nature of omniscience and manifest enlightenment, which is the mind's complete purity of that kind.

original: rtog pa @82a * //
analyzed: rtog pa @82a * //
translated: It is called secret because it is not within the range of experience of ordinary beings, and because it is not taught to those who are not suitable vessels.

original: kun gyis rig mi nus //
analyzed: kun gyis rig mi nus //
translated: It cannot be known by any conception.

original: zhes pa ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems te /
translated: This is the mind whose characteristic is emptiness.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas de ji bzhin pa mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas de ji bzhin pa mi rtogs pa'o //

original: yid la bsdus la nyon cig pa ni ma yengs par nyon cig pa'o //
analyzed: yid la bsdus la nyon cig pa ni ma yengs par nyon cig pa'o //
translated: Listen with a concentrated mind means listen without distraction.

original: sems brgya drug cu las 'das pa'i skye bo'i 'og tu zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu las 'das nas chos la bdag med par rtogs te mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sems gsum rnam par bsgom pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rnam par spyad pa dang /
analyzed: sems brgya drug cu las 'das pa'i skye bo'i 'og tu zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu las 'das nas chos la bdag med par rtogs te mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sems gsum rnam par bsgom pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rnam par spyad pa dang /
translated: One cultivates the three mental states, practices the perfections,üîΩand practices the four means of gathering disciples.

original: bsdu pa'i dngos po rnam bzhi byas nas mos pa spyod pa'i sa las 'phar te /
analyzed: bsdu pa'i dngos po rnam bzhi byas nas mos pa spyod pa'i sa las 'phar te /
translated: After passing beyond the stage of devoted engagement,

original: sa rab tu dga' ba'i sems ye shes kyi sa la zhugs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba'i sems ye shes kyi sa la zhugs pa la bya ste /
translated: one enters the stage of the wisdom of the Joyous.

original: ji snyed cig tu 'das nas skye zhing dris pa'i lan to //
analyzed: ji snyed cig tu 'das nas skye zhing dris pa'i lan to //
translated: This is the answer to the question of how many stages one passes through and how many births one has.

original: bsod nams chen po zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams chen po'i rgyu las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams chen po zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams chen po'i rgyu las skyes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgreat merit‚Äù means that it is born from the cause of great merit, such as the perfections.

original: snying po zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pa yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: snying po zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pa yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúessence‚Äù means that it is completely perfected and is not mistaken.

original: dper na tsandan dang seng ldeng gi snying po ltar mchog dam pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dper na tsandan dang seng ldeng gi snying po ltar mchog dam pa la bya'o //
translated: It is like the essence of sandalwood or aloe wood, and is the most excellent and sublime.

original: byang chub phyir du byang chub 'byung //
analyzed: byang chub phyir du byang chub 'byung //
translated: It arises for the sake of enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems de las sems 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems de las sems 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: This means that the thought of enlightenment arises from the thought of enlightenment in order to attain supreme enlightenment.

original: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: It is immeasurable like space.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de'i yon tan la sogs pa tshad gzung zhing dpag tu med pa'am /
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de'i yon tan la sogs pa tshad gzung zhing dpag tu med pa'am /
translated: This means that the qualities, etc. of the thought of enlightenment are immeasurable and cannot be assessed.

original: de bzhin dpag tu med pas 'di tsam mo zhes tshad gzung du med de nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin dpag tu med pas 'di tsam mo zhes tshad gzung du med de nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la bya'o //
translated: Or, it is immeasurable because it is like space, in that it cannot be assessed as being this much.

original: gos pa med pa ji bzhin gnas //
analyzed: gos pa med pa ji bzhin gnas //
translated: It abides as if unsoiled.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sems nam mkha'i mtshan nyid la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis ma gos pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sems nam mkha'i mtshan nyid la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis ma gos pa ste /
translated: This means that such a thought, which has the characteristic of space, is unsoiled by the instincts of adventitious afflictions.

original: de ltar glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa ji bzhin pa'i dbang du ma gyur pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa ji bzhin pa'i dbang du ma gyur pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la bya'o //
translated: It abides in a nature of complete purity, because it is not under the sway of adventitious afflictions as they really are.

original: chos kun gyis ni yongs mi g-yos //
analyzed: chos kun gyis ni yongs mi g-yos //
translated: It is unmoved by any phenomena.

original: tshad med ye shes kyis bsgrubs pa //
analyzed: tshad med ye shes kyis bsgrubs pa //
translated: It is accomplished by immeasurable intuition.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de tshad med pa'i ye shes las 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de tshad med pa'i ye shes las 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: This refers to the origin of the thought of enlightenment from immeasurable intuition.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is seen in the perfect Buddha.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la mchod pa byas pa dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa spyad pa las byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la mchod pa byas pa dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa spyad pa las byung ste /
translated: This refers to the thought of enlightenment that arises from worship of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas and from the practice of the stages and perfections.

original: de ni / de yi spyad pa ci 'dra ba /
analyzed: de ni / de yi spyad pa ci 'dra ba /
translated: What is the practice of that?

original: zhes dris pa'i lan to //
analyzed: zhes dris pa'i lan to //
translated: This is the reply to the question.

original: byang chub dang po zhes kyang bya //
analyzed: byang chub dang po zhes kyang bya //
translated: It is also called the first enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang @82b chub kyi sems la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa dang po'i byang @82b chub kyi sems la bya ste /
translated: This refers to the thought of enlightenment on the first stage.

original: de rnams ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin bshad pa'o //
translated: These are the explanation of the cause and nature of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de lta bas na gsang ba'i bdag po 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bus pa so sor 'gro ba rnams zhes pa nas zhes rtog go zhes pa'i bar du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bshad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gsang ba'i bdag po 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bus pa so sor 'gro ba rnams zhes pa nas zhes rtog go zhes pa'i bar du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu bshad pa la bya ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Vairocana's cause should be understood as explained up to...üîΩconceive of the world.

original: rgyu de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rgyu de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, that cause is twofold.

original: de la yang 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu len pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la yang 'jig rten pa'i sems brgya drug cu la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyu len pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Among them, the one hundred and sixty mundane minds, etc., are the appropriating cause of Vairocana's cause.

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan ni lhan cig pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan ni lhan cig pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The other stages and perfections are the co-existent cause.

original: de bas na so sor 'gro ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bas na so sor 'gro ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, the individual ways are also twofold.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gzhung lugs shes pa dang mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gzhung lugs shes pa dang mi shes pa'o //
translated: They are knowing and not knowing the worldly scriptural tradition.

original: de la byis pas ni ngan par smra ba dang / ngan par byed pa dang / ngan par sems pa ste /
analyzed: de la byis pas ni ngan par smra ba dang / ngan par byed pa dang / ngan par sems pa ste /
translated: Among them, the childish have bad speech, bad action, and bad thoughts.

original: de dag ni rang gi gzhung lugs kyang mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi gzhung lugs kyang mi shes pa'o //
translated: They do not even know their own scriptural tradition.

original: de las gzhan pa ni rang rang gi gzhung lugs shes pa 'phags pa'i lam thob pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni rang rang gi gzhung lugs shes pa 'phags pa'i lam thob pa la bya ste /
translated: Others are those who know their own scriptures and obtain the ƒÅrya path.

original: de dag 'khor ba na sdug bsngal gsum gyis gdungs nas gdungs pa de las thar pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag 'khor ba na sdug bsngal gsum gyis gdungs nas gdungs pa de las thar pa'i phyir /
translated: They are tormented by the three sufferings in sa·πÉsƒÅra, and in order to be free from that torment,

original: bdag dang bdag gir brtags pa de dag la brtan nas sbyin pa la sogs pa byas nas thar par re ba'o //üîΩbdag dang bdag gi ba la mngon par chags nas bdag tu 'dzin pa grangs med pa la rtog pa de dag kyang bdag ces pa'i rang bzhin ci 'dra bar ma spyad par chags pa skye ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs mi shes pa'i byis pa rnams so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir brtags pa de dag la brtan nas sbyin pa la sogs pa byas nas thar par re ba'o // bdag dang bdag gi ba la mngon par chags nas bdag tu 'dzin pa grangs med pa la rtog pa de dag kyang bdag ces pa'i rang bzhin ci 'dra bar ma spyad par chags pa skye ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs mi shes pa'i byis pa rnams so //
translated: they rely on the imputation of self and mine and, through giving and so on, hope for liberation.üîΩThose who, through attachment to self and mine, conceive of countless selves are childish beings who do not understand the nature of self.

original: rang rang gi lugs shes pa de rnams kyang so so'i bdag tu brtags pa de la brten pa ni kha cig ni dus las byung ngo zhes pa nas smra ba'o mi smra ba'o zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rang rang gi lugs shes pa de rnams kyang so so'i bdag tu brtags pa de la brten pa ni kha cig ni dus las byung ngo zhes pa nas smra ba'o mi smra ba'o zhes pa'i bar du ste /
