original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis so so'i bdag tu brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis so so'i bdag tu brtags pa ste /
translated: Those are the individual selves imagined by worldly people.

original: ji skad du smos pa'i bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo de dag gis bdag cag 'gro ba rnams bskyed de /
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo de dag gis bdag cag 'gro ba rnams bskyed de /
translated: Those natures of self and mine mentioned generate us transmigrating beings.

original: 'jig par byed pa yang de dag nyid par rtog pas /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa yang de dag nyid par rtog pas /
translated: They are also imagined to be what causes our destruction.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de lta bu la sogs pa zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i bdag gi dngos po rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de lta bu la sogs pa zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i bdag gi dngos po rnams la bya'o //
translated: Lord of Secrets, those and so forth refer to the natures of self mentioned above.

original: thar par re ba'i phyir zhes pa ni de lta bu ba bdag tu brtags pa nyid la brten nas thar par re ba'o //
analyzed: thar par re ba'i phyir zhes pa ni de lta bu ba bdag tu brtags pa nyid la brten nas thar par re ba'o //
translated: Because of hoping for liberation refers to hoping for liberation based on just those imagined selves.

original: sbyor bas sbyor bar 'dod pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tshul du lus ngag yid gsum yul la 'jug pa la 'gog pa dang dngos po gang la dmags pa de la sems rtse @83a * //
analyzed: sbyor bas sbyor bar 'dod pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tshul du lus ngag yid gsum yul la 'jug pa la 'gog pa dang dngos po gang la dmags pa de la sems rtse @83a * //
translated: Those who wish to engage in union refers to those who engage in objects with body, speech, and mind in the worldly way.

original: gcig tu dmigs pa'am 'jog pa ni sbyor ba ste lus ngag yid gsum yul la mi 'jug par 'gog pa'i sbyor bar 'dod pa rnams kyis de lta bu'i bdag rnams rab tu rtog pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gcig tu dmigs pa'am 'jog pa ni sbyor ba ste lus ngag yid gsum yul la mi 'jug par 'gog pa'i sbyor bar 'dod pa rnams kyis de lta bu'i bdag rnams rab tu rtog pa la bya'o //
translated: The one-pointed focus or fixation is the application, which is to be understood as the imagination of such a self by those who maintain that the application is the cessation of the engagement of body, speech, and mind in objects.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams phyugs dang 'dra zhes pa ni rang gi lugs mi shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams phyugs dang 'dra zhes pa ni rang gi lugs mi shes pa la bya ste /
translated: The statement childish ordinary beings are like cattle is to be understood as referring to those who do not know their own system.

original: phyugs dang 'dra zhes pa ni ngan du smra ba dang ngan du sems pa dang / ngan du byed pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: phyugs dang 'dra zhes pa ni ngan du smra ba dang ngan du sems pa dang / ngan du byed pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The statement like cattle is an example of bad speech, bad thought, and bad action.

original: phyugs ni za ba dang / g-yem pa dang 'jigs pa las bsam ba gzhan med de /
analyzed: phyugs ni za ba dang / g-yem pa dang 'jigs pa las bsam ba gzhan med de /
translated: Cattle have no thoughts other than eating, copulating, and fearing.

original: byis pa rnams kyang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas phyugs dang 'dra zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas phyugs dang 'dra zhes pa'o //
translated: Since childish beings have characteristics like that, they are like cattle.

original: brgyal gal te kha cig ces pa de lta bu'i byis pa phyugs dang 'dra ba 'khor ba na 'khyam pa na chos kyi 'du shes skyes pa ni shin tu dkon pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: brgyal gal te kha cig ces pa de lta bu'i byis pa phyugs dang 'dra ba 'khor ba na 'khyam pa na chos kyi 'du shes skyes pa ni shin tu dkon pa'i mchog ste /
translated: If some of those childish beings like cattle who wander in cyclic existence generate the idea of the Dharma, that is the supreme rarity.

original: chos kyi 'du shes skye ba yang smyung bar 'dug nas bsod nams su 'gyur ba la bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'du shes skye ba yang smyung bar 'dug nas bsod nams su 'gyur ba la bya ste /
translated: The arising of the idea of Dharma is also to be taken as the merit of fasting.

original: smyung bar 'dug pa de tsam gyis sems mgu ste /
analyzed: smyung bar 'dug pa de tsam gyis sems mgu ste /
translated: The mind is pleased with just that fasting.

original: smyung bar 'dug pa de nyid la yang dang yang du dus su goms par byed de /
analyzed: smyung bar 'dug pa de nyid la yang dang yang du dus su goms par byed de /
translated: One becomes accustomed to fasting at the proper time again and again.

original: de bas na gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: smyung bar 'dug go zhes pa nas /
analyzed: smyung bar 'dug go zhes pa nas /
translated: ‚ÄúI will fast‚Äù up to

original: de tsam gyis sems mgu ba skyes te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis sems mgu ba skyes te /
translated: ‚Äúthe mind is pleased with just that.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de dag la goms par byed do zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la goms par byed do zhes so //
translated: Therefore, one becomes accustomed to that.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de ni dge ba las byung ba'i phyir sems dang po ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de ni dge ba las byung ba'i phyir sems dang po ste /
translated: Lord of Secrets, that is the first thought because it arises from virtue.

original: sa bon du gyur pa'o zhes pa ni sems /
analyzed: sa bon du gyur pa'o zhes pa ni sems /
translated: It is the seed.

original: bdun po'i tshe tshul khrims bsrungs pa'i dge ba las byung ba'i sa bon du gyur pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bdun po'i tshe tshul khrims bsrungs pa'i dge ba las byung ba'i sa bon du gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: It is the seed that arises from virtue, the morality observed during the seven days.

original: de la 'ga' zhig dogs pa skye ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig dogs pa skye ba ste /
translated: Some doubt arises about that.

original: smyung bar 'dug pa ni brtul zhugs kyi mtshan nyid de nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig yin na /
analyzed: smyung bar 'dug pa ni brtul zhugs kyi mtshan nyid de nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig yin na /
translated: If fasting is the definition of asceticism, which is one part of the afflictions,

original: ji ltar dge ba'i sa bon du 'gyur snyam pa la dogs pa bsal ba smyung bar byas pa'i 'og tu mchod pa dang sbyin pa'i sems 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba'i sa bon du 'gyur snyam pa la dogs pa bsal ba smyung bar byas pa'i 'og tu mchod pa dang sbyin pa'i sems 'byung ste /
translated: To dispel that doubt, after fasting, the thought of offering and giving arises.

original: smyung ba de ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: smyung ba de ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen pas nyes pa med do //
translated: That fasting is not a fault because it is the immediate condition of virtue such as giving.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba la bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba la bya'o //
translated: And that giving and so on is to be done in contaminated virtue.

original: de'i rgyus ni sbyin pa byin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyus ni sbyin pa byin pa ste /
translated: From that cause, one gives gifts.

original: ltas dang sbyor pa nyid pas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ltas dang sbyor pa nyid pas zhes pa ni /
translated: Because of the connection with omens,

original: smyung bar byed pa de nyid las goms par byed pa'i rgyus zla ba dang skar ma dang / nyi ma la sogs pa bzang po'i nyin par pha ma la sogs pa'i gnyen rnams la sbyin par byed pa ni tshul khrims bsrungs pa'i dge ba'i las las byung ba'i myu gur blta'o//
analyzed: smyung bar byed pa de nyid las goms par byed pa'i rgyus zla ba dang skar ma dang / nyi ma la sogs pa bzang po'i nyin par pha ma la sogs pa'i gnyen rnams la sbyin par byed pa ni tshul khrims bsrungs pa'i dge ba'i las las byung ba'i myu gur blta'o//
translated: on an auspicious day of the moon, stars, and sun, one gives to relatives such as one's parents. That is seen as a sprout arising from the virtuous karma of observing ethics.

original: @83b de nas yang sbyin pa de ni ma 'dris pa la sbyin pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: @83b de nas yang sbyin pa de ni ma 'dris pa la sbyin pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, that giving is giving to the unfamiliar.

original: sbyin pa snga ma la goms pa'i mthus gnyen ma yin pa gzhan la yang sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa snga ma la goms pa'i mthus gnyen ma yin pa gzhan la yang sbyin pa ste /
translated: By the power of being accustomed to previous generosity, one gives to others who are not one's friends.

original: de yang dge ba bcu'i las 'byung pa'i rgyu ste sdong bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang dge ba bcu'i las 'byung pa'i rgyu ste sdong bu lta bu'o //
translated: That is the cause from which virtue arises, like a trunk.üîΩThen, seeking the vessel of generosity, one gives.

original: de nas yang sbyin pa'i snod tshol zhing sbyin no zhes pa ni pa dang ma dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang / bram ze smrang bzhi rdzogs par shes pa la sbyin na /
analyzed: de nas yang sbyin pa'i snod tshol zhing sbyin no zhes pa ni pa dang ma dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang / bram ze smrang bzhi rdzogs par shes pa la sbyin na /
translated: If one gives to one's mother, father, preceptor, teacher, and to those who know the four Vedas,

original: de dag ni sbyin gnas te bsod nams mtha' med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni sbyin gnas te bsod nams mtha' med par 'gyur te /
translated: they are the recipients of generosity, and merit becomes limitless.

original: de dag ni sbyin pa'i snod do snyam nas sbyin par byed pa de yang dge ba 'byung ba'i rgyu ste 'dab ma lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sbyin pa'i snod do snyam nas sbyin par byed pa de yang dge ba 'byung ba'i rgyu ste 'dab ma lta bur blta'o //
translated: Thinking that they are the vessels of generosity, one gives. That is also the cause from which virtue arises, like leaves.

original: de nas yang sbyin pa de spyod pa'i gnas dang bla ma la dga' bzhin du sbyin pa zhes pa ni sbyin pa de ni snga ma las rgya che ste /
analyzed: de nas yang sbyin pa de spyod pa'i gnas dang bla ma la dga' bzhin du sbyin pa zhes pa ni sbyin pa de ni snga ma las rgya che ste /
translated: Then, that generosity is the joy of the abode of practice and the guru.

original: snod la yang mi rtog par bla ma dang rol mo mkhan la sogs pa sems dga' bar sbyin pa'i dngos po la ma chags par sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: snod la yang mi rtog par bla ma dang rol mo mkhan la sogs pa sems dga' bar sbyin pa'i dngos po la ma chags par sbyin pa ste /
translated: Without any concept of a recipient, one gives to the guru, musicians, and so forth, without attachment to the things that are given, which bring joy to the mind.

original: de yang dge ba'i las 'byung ba'i rgyu ste me tog lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: de yang dge ba'i las 'byung ba'i rgyu ste me tog lta bur blta'o //
translated: That is to be seen as the cause for the arising of virtuous karma, like a flower.

original: de nas sbyin pa de 'dod pa rnams la sbyin pa ni zas 'dod pa la zas /
analyzed: de nas sbyin pa de 'dod pa rnams la sbyin pa ni zas 'dod pa la zas /
translated: Then, giving that generosity to those who desire it is giving food to those who desire food,

original: gos 'dod pa la gos la sogs pa ci 'dod pa rnams sbyin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gos 'dod pa la gos la sogs pa ci 'dod pa rnams sbyin pa la bya ste /
translated: clothing to those who desire clothing, and so on, giving whatever is desired.

original: de yang dge ba'i las byung ba'i rgyu ste 'bras bu lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: de yang dge ba'i las byung ba'i rgyu ste 'bras bu lta bur blta'o //
translated: That is to be seen as the result of the arising of virtuous karma.

original: de nas yang gsang pa'i bdag po mtho ris su skye ba'i phyir tshul khrims bsrung zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas yang gsang pa'i bdag po mtho ris su skye ba'i phyir tshul khrims bsrung zhes pa ni /
translated: Next, in order to be born in the higher realms, the one who guards morality

original: de lta bu'i sbyin pa rnams byas nas lus kyi las gsum dang / ngag gi las bzhi dang / yid kyi las gsum gyi sgo nas mi dge ba 'byung ba spong ba'i mtshan nyid tshul khrims bsrungs nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyin pa rnams byas nas lus kyi las gsum dang / ngag gi las bzhi dang / yid kyi las gsum gyi sgo nas mi dge ba 'byung ba spong ba'i mtshan nyid tshul khrims bsrungs nas /
translated: is as follows: Having performed those kinds of generosity, one guards morality, which is defined as the abandonment of the arising of nonvirtue through the three physical actions, the four verbal actions, and the three mental actions.

original: de'i 'bras bu mngon par 'chad pa'i mtshan nyid lha la sogs pa'i longs spyod mtho ris su skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu mngon par 'chad pa'i mtshan nyid lha la sogs pa'i longs spyod mtho ris su skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: The result of that is the characteristic of the manifest enjoyment of gods and so on, because it is born in the higher realms.

original: longs spyod de nyid ga sogs su 'gyur ba la bya'o //

translated: The cultivation of the elimination of the two obscurations is the cultivation of the three minds, beginning from the mundane path up to the end of three eons, cultivating the selflessness of the person.

original: de nas phung po la yang snyam pa'i blo skye ba de yang sun phyin nas phung po la sogs pa dang / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur chos la bdag med par chud de sems gsum bsgom ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid mos pa spyod pa'i sa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de nas phung po la yang snyam pa'i blo skye ba de yang sun phyin nas phung po la sogs pa dang / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur chos la bdag med par chud de sems gsum bsgom ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid mos pa spyod pa'i sa la 'jug go //
translated: Then, the mind that thinks of the aggregates is also refuted, and one penetrates the selflessness of phenomena, that the aggregates and so on are like illusions and mirages. One enters the level of engagement through resolute practice, which is characterized by the analysis of the perfections and so on.

original: dbang po rnon po ni thog ma nyid nas gang zag dang chos gnyis ka la bdag med par chud pas /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni thog ma nyid nas gang zag dang chos gnyis ka la bdag med par chud pas /
translated: Those of sharp faculties penetrate the selflessness of both persons and phenomena from the very beginning.

original: sems de rnams kyang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu'i tshul gyis spong zhing sems gsum po sgom pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rnam par dpyod pa'i rim gyis mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs nas bskal pa de'i bzhi cha gcig gis ye shesüîΩkyi sa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sems de rnams kyang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu'i tshul gyis spong zhing sems gsum po sgom pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rnam par dpyod pa'i rim gyis mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs nas bskal pa de'i bzhi cha gcig gis ye shes kyi sa la 'jug go //
translated: Having perfected the stage of resolute conduct in one eon, in one quarter of that eon, one enters the stage of wisdom.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la zhugs nas ni dbang po rno rtul gnyis ka yang mos pa spyod pa'i sa la de bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs par byed pa dang / ye shes kyi sa la bskal pa bzhi cha gcig gis 'jug par 'dra'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la zhugs nas ni dbang po rno rtul gnyis ka yang mos pa spyod pa'i sa la de bskal pa gcig gis rdzogs par byed pa dang / ye shes kyi sa la bskal pa bzhi cha gcig gis 'jug par 'dra'o //
translated: Having entered the stage of resolute conduct, both those of sharp and dull faculties perfect the stage of resolute conduct in one eon and enter the stage of wisdom in one quarter of that eon.

original: sems kyi dngos bo drug cu rnams las brgyu drug cur 'brel pa yang /
analyzed: sems kyi dngos bo drug cu rnams las brgyu drug cur 'brel pa yang /
translated: From among the sixty mental entities, there are sixty connections.

original: sgrib pa'i cha spom phra gsum du phye ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa'i cha spom phra gsum du phye ste /
translated: The three aspects of obscuration are divided into three:üîΩgross, subtle, and very subtle.

original: gsum po de rnams las gcig cing yang gsum gsum du bsgo ste rnam dgur blta'o //
analyzed: gsum po de rnams las gcig cing yang gsum gsum du bsgo ste rnam dgur blta'o //
translated: Each of those three is divided into three, making nine.

original: de la sgrib pa chen po'i chen po la sems gcig spong /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa chen po'i chen po la sems gcig spong /
translated: The very gross of the gross is abandoned by one mind.

original: chen po'i 'bring po la gnyis spong /
analyzed: chen po'i 'bring po la gnyis spong /
translated: On the medium of the great, two are abandoned.

original: chen po'i chung ngu la gsum spong /
analyzed: chen po'i chung ngu la gsum spong /
translated: On the small of the great, three are abandoned.

original: 'bring po'i chen po la bzhi spong /
analyzed: 'bring po'i chen po la bzhi spong /
translated: On the great of the medium, four are abandoned.

original: 'bring po'i 'bring po la lnga spong /
analyzed: 'bring po'i 'bring po la lnga spong /
translated: On the medium of the medium, five are abandoned.

original: 'bring po'i chung ngu drug spong /
analyzed: 'bring po'i chung ngu drug spong /
translated: On the small of the medium, six are abandoned.

original: chung ngu'i chen po la bdun spong /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po la bdun spong /
translated: On the great of the small, seven are abandoned.

original: chung ngu'i 'bring po la brgyad spong /
analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring po la brgyad spong /
translated: On the medium of the small, eight are abandoned.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis de ltar sems brgya drug cu mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas spong zhing mos pa spyod pa'i sa de rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis de ltar sems brgya drug cu mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas spong zhing mos pa spyod pa'i sa de rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In this way, one abandons the one hundred and sixty thoughts on the level of practice by means of aspiration and perfects that level of practice by means of aspiration.

original: de la dgu rnams kyi mthar chung ngu'i yang chung ngu ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas spong ste /
analyzed: de la dgu rnams kyi mthar chung ngu'i yang chung ngu ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas spong ste /
translated: At the end of the nine, the small of the small is abandoned on the level of practice by means of aspiration.

original: ye shes kyi sa la 'jug par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sa la 'jug par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one enters the level of wisdom.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind of attachment?

original: 'dod chags kyi chos ba ston pa'o zhes pa la 'dod chags kyi sems zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi chos ba ston pa'o zhes pa la 'dod chags kyi sems zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la bya ste /
translated: It is the teaching of the phenomena of attachment. A mind of attachment is a mind that possesses attachment.

original: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lung du mi ston pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi las ji ltar rigs pa chags @86a * //
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lung du mi ston pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi las ji ltar rigs pa chags @86a * //
translated: Moreover, it is any of the four types of phenomena: virtuous, nonvirtuous, afflicted or neutral.üîΩ

original: pas bsnyen par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: pas bsnyen par shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one should know that one is close to passion through any of the four kinds of dharmas: good, bad, defiled, and indeterminate.üîΩOne is close to passion through good dharmas,

original: lha la sogs pa la dad cing mchod par bya ba la zhen nas mchod pa la sogs pa'i las de dag byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bsnyen par byed pa la bya ste dge ba'o //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa la dad cing mchod par bya ba la zhen nas mchod pa la sogs pa'i las de dag byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bsnyen par byed pa la bya ste dge ba'o //
translated: as when one is attached to and worships gods, etc., and performs such actions as worship, etc.üîΩOne is close to passion through bad dharmas,

original: de bzhin du bud med la sogs pa la zhen nas de'i bya ba byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bsnyen pa ste /üîΩnyon mongs pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med la sogs pa la zhen nas de'i bya ba byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bsnyen pa ste / nyon mongs pa'i sems so //
translated: as when one is attached to women, etc., and performs the actions associated with them.üîΩOne is close to passion through defiled dharmas,

original: ma byin par len pa dang / brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i chos la zhen nas de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bsnyen pa ste mi dge ba'i sems so //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i chos la zhen nas de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bsnyen pa ste mi dge ba'i sems so //
translated: as when one is attached to such things as taking what is not given, lying, etc., and performs the actions associated with them.

original: bzo la sogs pa'i chos la zhen nas de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bsnyen pa ste lung du mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: bzo la sogs pa'i chos la zhen nas de dag gi bya ba byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bsnyen pa ste lung du mi ston pa'o //
translated: The mind that is attached to the phenomena of craftsmanship and so on, and that engages in their activities, is the mind that is attached to the phenomena of passion.

original: de ltar sems gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par dge ba dang mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa dang lung du ma bstan pa 'di'i tshul gyis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par dge ba dang mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa dang lung du ma bstan pa 'di'i tshul gyis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, the other minds should be applied to virtue, nonvirtue, affliction, and the indeterminate, as is appropriate.

original: 'dod chags med pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind without passion?

original: ma chags par chos bsnyen pa ste gong du smos pa'i chos rnam bzhi la ma chags pa'am /üîΩma mos kyang chos nyid kyis spyod pa'am /
analyzed: ma chags par chos bsnyen pa ste gong du smos pa'i chos rnam bzhi la ma chags pa'am / ma mos kyang chos nyid kyis spyod pa'am /
translated: It is a mind that is not attached to the four phenomena mentioned above.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du mi spyod bzhin du de dag gi bya ba byed pa 'dod mi chags pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du mi spyod bzhin du de dag gi bya ba byed pa 'dod mi chags pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
translated: It is a mind that does not delight in the phenomena of passion, but that engages in them through the power of circumstances, or that engages in them without being controlled by them.

original: zhe sdang gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind of hatred?

original: zhe sdang gi chos bsnyen pa zhes pa ni zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems de gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi chos bsnyen pa zhes pa ni zhe sdang dang ldan pa'i sems de gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma that is practiced with an angry mind should be understood as virtuous, nonvirtuous, and so on, in the manner that was explained above.

original: byams pa'i sems gang zhen /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems gang zhen /
translated: What is a loving mind?

original: byams pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i chos bsnyen pa ste zhes pa ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems de dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byams pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i chos bsnyen pa ste zhes pa ni byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems de dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The Dharma that is practiced with love is the Dharma that is practiced with a loving mind.

original: gti mug gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: gti mug gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a deluded mind?

original: mi dpyod par chos bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems so //
analyzed: mi dpyod par chos bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems so //
translated: The Dharma that is practiced without analysis is the Dharma that is practiced with a deluded mind.

original: shes rab kyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a wise mind?

original: khyad par las khyas par du chud pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems de khyad par zhes pa ni shes rab ma thob pa las shes rab thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par las khyas par du chud pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems de khyad par zhes pa ni shes rab ma thob pa las shes rab thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Dharma that is practiced with wisdom is the Dharma that is practiced with a wise mind.

original: khyad par gzhan du zhes pa ni shes rab de thob pa las shes rab dam pa'i khyad par du chud pa la bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan du zhes pa ni shes rab de thob pa las shes rab dam pa'i khyad par du chud pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin particular‚Äù means that the attainment of wisdom is a special quality of the highest wisdom.

original: gdon mi za ba'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: gdon mi za ba'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the certain mind?

original: bka' dang bla ma'i tshig bzhin byed pa zhes pa ni rgyal po la sogs pa'i bka' dang slob dpon la sogs pa'i lung mi @86b byar mi rung ste nges par bya ba'i chos de byed pa'o //
analyzed: bka' dang bla ma'i tshig bzhin byed pa zhes pa ni rgyal po la sogs pa'i bka' dang slob dpon la sogs pa'i lung mi @86b byar mi rung ste nges par bya ba'i chos de byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúacts in accordance with the words of the Buddha and the guru‚Äù means that one should not act contrary to the words of the king and so on, or the words of the teacher and so on.

original: the tshom gyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom gyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the doubtful mind?

original: ji ltar gdon mi zab nyid la dogs pas bsnyen pa'i zhes pa ni the tshom dang ldan pa'i sems de sngar phyin ci ma log par zin pa la phyis bdag nyid kyis the tshom bslang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gdon mi zab nyid la dogs pas bsnyen pa'i zhes pa ni the tshom dang ldan pa'i sems de sngar phyin ci ma log par zin pa la phyis bdag nyid kyis the tshom bslang ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving previously ascertained the object without error, later generates doubt about it‚Äù means that the doubtful mind is one that previously ascertained the object without error, but later generates doubt about it.

original: dgos pa skye bar byed pa ni de'i chos la bsnyen pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa skye bar byed pa ni de'i chos la bsnyen pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit causes the arising of the need‚Äù means that it causes the arising of the need for the Dharma.

original: mun par gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: mun par gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscured mind?

original: mi dogs pa la dogs par shes pa'o zhes pa ni mun pa lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: mi dogs pa la dogs par shes pa'o zhes pa ni mun pa lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the knowledge that doubts what is not doubted‚Äù means that the obscured mind is like darkness.

original: ji ltar mun pa'i nang na bum pa la sogs pa yod kyang gsal bar mi snang bas yod dam med dgos pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mun pa'i nang na bum pa la sogs pa yod kyang gsal bar mi snang bas yod dam med dgos pa ste /
translated: Just as in the darkness of night, a pot and so on may exist but are not clearly seen, so that one doubts whether they exist or not.

original: de bzhin du sems mun ba dang 'dra ba yang dngos po phyin ci ma log pa la ma rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pas dogs pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems mun ba dang 'dra ba yang dngos po phyin ci ma log pa la ma rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pas dogs pa skye ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the mind, which is like darkness, is obscured by the darkness of ignorance with regard to the undistorted thing, and so doubt arises.

original: snang bar gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that is clear?

original: the tshom med pa la the tshom med par bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sems te /
analyzed: the tshom med pa la the tshom med par bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind that is clear is the one that, with regard to what is without doubt, is without doubt.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' snang ba la rdzas kyi dngos po snang bar gsal ba bzhin du snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs de yang sems des kyang shes par bya'i dngos po the tshom med par shes nas /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' snang ba la rdzas kyi dngos po snang bar gsal ba bzhin du snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs de yang sems des kyang shes par bya'i dngos po the tshom med par shes nas /
translated: Just as in the light of day, a substantial thing is clearly seen, so the form that is of the nature of light is known by that mind.

original: de nyid la the tshom med bzhin du spyod pa ni the tshom med pa'i chos la bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la the tshom med bzhin du spyod pa ni the tshom med pa'i chos la bsnyen pa'o //
translated: Having known the thing without doubt, one practices with regard to it without doubt.

original: sdud pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdud pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that is contracted?

original: gang du ma las gcig tu sdud pa zhes pa ni sdud pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
analyzed: gang du ma las gcig tu sdud pa zhes pa ni sdud pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
translated: The mind of inclusion is that which includes many in one.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid so so pa las stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid du gcig tu sdud pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid so so pa las stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid du gcig tu sdud pa'o //
translated: It is the mind that includes the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc., in the general characteristics of emptiness, selflessness, etc., from their individual specific characteristics.

original: 'thab mo'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'thab mo'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of contention?

original: phan tshun rtsod pa'o zhes pa ni 'thab mo can gyi sems te mi mthun pa'i mu re re bzung zhing rtsod pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rtsod pa'o zhes pa ni 'thab mo can gyi sems te mi mthun pa'i mu re re bzung zhing rtsod pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
translated: It is the mind of those who are contentious, who take up each extreme of discord and adhere to it.

original: rtsod pa dang bral ba'i sems gang zhe na /üîΩgang bdag nyid la bdag gis rtsod pa'o zhes pa ni rtsod pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
analyzed: rtsod pa dang bral ba'i sems gang zhe na / gang bdag nyid la bdag gis rtsod pa'o zhes pa ni rtsod pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
translated: What is the mind free from contention?üîΩIt is the mind of those who are free from contention, who do not take up the extremes of discord and adhere to them.

original: gzhan yang phan tshun du mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzung zhing mi rtsod par bdag rang gi sems la sun 'byin pa'am /üîΩdpyod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phan tshun du mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzung zhing mi rtsod par bdag rang gi sems la sun 'byin pa'am / dpyod pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the mind that is free from contention, which is the opposite of the above.üîΩIt is the mind that is free from contention, which is the opposite of the above.

original: mi rtsod pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtsod pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of non-contention?

original: mnyam par snyoms par rtog pa'o zhes pa ni rtsod pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
analyzed: mnyam par snyoms par rtog pa'o zhes pa ni rtsod pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
translated: The mind that is free from dispute is the mind that is equal and impartial.

original: dngos po gang yang rung ba la gzhan dang lta ba mthun pas mtshungs par spyod de /üîΩrtsod pa med pa'i chos bsnyen @87a * //
analyzed: dngos po gang yang rung ba la gzhan dang lta ba mthun pas mtshungs par spyod de / rtsod pa med pa'i chos bsnyen @87a * //
translated: It is the mind that is in agreement with others about any given thing.

original: par byed pa'o //
analyzed: par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the mind that is free from dispute and that is devoted to the Dharma.

original: lha'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: lha'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of a god?

original: yid la yid kyis rtog pa'o zhes pa ni lha lta bu'i sems sam lha'i phyir sems pa ste /
analyzed: yid la yid kyis rtog pa'o zhes pa ni lha lta bu'i sems sam lha'i phyir sems pa ste /
translated: It is the mind that thinks with the mind.üîΩThe mind that is like a god is the mind that thinks for the sake of the gods.

original: lha lta bur sems pa ni ji ltar lha rnams bdag ni lha yin no snyam du sems pa bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid gang yin pa de yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: lha lta bur sems pa ni ji ltar lha rnams bdag ni lha yin no snyam du sems pa bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid gang yin pa de yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The mind that is like a god is the mind that thinks, ‚ÄúI am a god.‚Äù

original: lha'i phyir sems pa ni bdag gi lhar gyur par bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i phyir sems pa ni bdag gi lhar gyur par bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The mind that thinks for the sake of the gods is the mind that thinks, ‚ÄúI will become a god.‚Äù

original: lha ma yin gyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of an asura?

original: gang 'khor ba la smon pa'o zhes pa ni lha ma yin lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang 'khor ba la smon pa'o zhes pa ni lha ma yin lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the mind that wishes for cyclic existence.

original: de ltar lha ma yin de la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la smon par byed pa de bzhin du sems de yang 'khor ba la smon par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha ma yin de la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la smon par byed pa de bzhin du sems de yang 'khor ba la smon par byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //
translated: Just as the asura, etc., are the things that are wished for, so the mind is the thing that is wished for in samsara.

original: klu'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: klu'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the naga mind?

original: spyod pa chen por sems pa'o zhes pa ni klu lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: spyod pa chen por sems pa'o zhes pa ni klu lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The mind that thinks of great enjoyment.

original: ji ltar klu phyug po la mgo mang po yod de /
analyzed: ji ltar klu phyug po la mgo mang po yod de /
translated: Just as a rich naga has many heads,

original: mgo mang so des longs spyod che bar shes pa bzhin du sems de yang longs spyod chen po spyod pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: mgo mang so des longs spyod che bar shes pa bzhin du sems de yang longs spyod chen po spyod pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
translated: so the mind is the thing that is wished for in the enjoyment of great wealth.

original: de la klu mgo mang po la ji ltar longs spyod kyi dper gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la klu mgo mang po la ji ltar longs spyod kyi dper gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the naga head an example of enjoyment?

original: rgya gar gyi skad du /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi skad du /
translated: In the Indian language,

original: longs spyod la bho ga / klu'i mgo la yang bho ga zhes bya ste skad kyi gzhung du mthun /
analyzed: longs spyod la bho ga / klu'i mgo la yang bho ga zhes bya ste skad kyi gzhung du mthun /

analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang longs spyod chen po'i chos la bsnyen par byed pas klu lta bu'i sems zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang 'dod pa'i yul rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir chos de dag la bsnyen par byed do //

original: dbang po'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i sems gang zhe na /

original: chun pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: chun pa'i sems gang zhe na /

analyzed: phyis zhing thog de rnams nyid la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa bya ba byed do //

analyzed: mtshe'u'i sems gang zhe na ;

analyzed: gang mtshan mo la sems pa'o zhes pa ni 'ug pa lta bu'i sems te /
translated: That which is thought at night.

original: 'ug pa ni bdag gis zas tshol ba la sogs pa bya ba thams cad mtshan mo byed do //
analyzed: 'ug pa ni bdag gis zas tshol ba la sogs pa bya ba thams cad mtshan mo byed do //
translated: The owl does all his activities at night, such as seeking food.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi bya ba rnams mtshan mo byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o //üîΩbya rog @89a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi bya ba rnams mtshan mo byed pa'i chos bsten pa'o // bya rog @89a * //
translated: Likewise, that thought is the cultivation of the Dharma of doing one‚Äôs activities at night.

original: gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the crow-like thought?üîΩThat which is thought in the evening.

original: gang bas thams cad sems pa'o zhes pa ni bya rog lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang bas thams cad sems pa'o zhes pa ni bya rog lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The mind that is like a crow is the mind that is afraid of everything.

original: bya rog ni kun gyis 'jigs shing brdabs bzhin du rang gi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: bya rog ni kun gyis 'jigs shing brdabs bzhin du rang gi bya ba byed de /
translated: A crow does its work while afraid and trembling.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang gang gis dngos po spyad pa thams cad bag tsha zhing brdabs pas brdabs pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang gang gis dngos po spyad pa thams cad bag tsha zhing brdabs pas brdabs pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, that mind is the mind that is afraid and trembling because of all the things that it has done, and it makes one practice the Dharma while trembling.

original: 'bar ba'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that is like a burning fire?üîΩThe mind that is like a burning fire is the mind that turns away from virtue.

original: gang dge ba rnams mi dge bar bzlog pa'o zhes pa ni 'bar ba lta bu'i sems te 'bar ba sngon dge ba la sogs pa spyad pa'i rgyus bdag mthu dang ldan par gyur pas mthu des gsod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams spyod de sems
analyzed: gang dge ba rnams mi dge bar bzlog pa'o zhes pa ni 'bar ba lta bu'i sems te 'bar ba sngon dge ba la sogs pa spyad pa'i rgyus bdag mthu dang ldan par gyur pas mthu des gsod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams spyod de sems
translated: That mind is the mind that, because of the power that comes from previously practicing virtue, etc., practices nonvirtuous things such as killing, etc., with that power.

original: de yang de lta bu'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //üîΩtsher ma'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang de lta bu'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o // tsher ma'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: And that mind makes one practice the Dharma in that way.üîΩWhat is the mind that is like a thorn?

original: gang thams cad 'gyod pa sgom pa'o zhes pa ni tsher ma lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang thams cad 'gyod pa sgom pa'o zhes pa ni tsher ma lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The mind that is like a thorn is the mind that cultivates regret for everything.

original: tsher ma ni 'dzugs shing gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tsher ma ni 'dzugs shing gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: A thorn is something that pierces and injures.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang gang byas pa'i dngos po la 'gyod pa skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang gang byas pa'i dngos po la 'gyod pa skye'o //
translated: In the same way, the mind also generates regret for what has been done.

original: 'gyod pa de nyid yang dang yang du yid la byed cing zug rdur gyur pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa de nyid yang dang yang du yid la byed cing zug rdur gyur pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
translated: That very regret is repeatedly brought to mind and becomes a painful phenomenon.

original: sa 'og gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa 'og gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind like the lower regions?üîΩIt is a mind that thinks about the meaning of the lower regions.

original: gang sa 'og gi don la sems pa'o zhes pa ni sa 'og gi phyir sems pa ste /
analyzed: gang sa 'og gi don la sems pa'o zhes pa ni sa 'og gi phyir sems pa ste /
translated: It is a mind that thinks about the lower regions for the sake of the lower regions.

original: sa 'og tu song nas de'i bya ba byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og tu song nas de'i bya ba byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
translated: It is a mind that is devoted to the practice of going to the lower regions and performing its activities.

original: rlung gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind like the wind?

original: gang thams cad du thams cad la rgyu ba'o zhes pa ni rlung lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang thams cad du thams cad la rgyu ba'o zhes pa ni rlung lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is a mind that moves everywhere and in every way.

original: rlung ni bar bar me'i nang du zhugs /
analyzed: rlung ni bar bar me'i nang du zhugs /
translated: The wind sometimes enters fire,

original: bar bar chu la sogs pa'i nang du zhugs pa de bzhin du sems de yang bar bar dge ba'i nang du zhugs te mi dge bar byed /
analyzed: bar bar chu la sogs pa'i nang du zhugs pa de bzhin du sems de yang bar bar dge ba'i nang du zhugs te mi dge bar byed /
translated: sometimes water, and so on. In the same way, the mind sometimes enters virtue and becomes non-virtuous,

original: bar bar mi dge ba'i nang du zhugs te dge bar byed de /
analyzed: bar bar mi dge ba'i nang du zhugs te dge bar byed de /
translated: sometimes enters non-virtue and becomes virtuous.

original: mdor na kun gyi nang du 'jug la yang mi gnas par byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na kun gyi nang du 'jug la yang mi gnas par byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
translated: In brief, the mind that is like a swamp is the one that, while engaging in all [virtuous activities], does not abide in them.

original: me'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: me'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that is like fire?

original: gang tsha ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gdungs pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang tsha ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gdungs pa zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the one that is tormented by the characteristic of heat.

original: me lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: me lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The mind that is like fire is

original: me ni rang gi tsha bas gdung bar byed de /
analyzed: me ni rang gi tsha bas gdung bar byed de /
translated: the one that is tormented by its own heat.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang rang gi dka' thub kyis lus dang sems gdungs shing sma 'bab par byed pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang rang gi dka' thub kyis lus dang sems gdungs shing sma 'bab par byed pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
translated: In the same way, this mind is also tormented by its own austerity, and it is the one that engages in the Dharma that causes the body and mind to be ashamed.

original: me dka' thub kyi dper ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: me dka' thub kyi dper ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can fire be an example of austerity?

original: rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du /
translated: In the Indian language,

original: tsha ba la ta pa zhes bya /
analyzed: tsha ba la ta pa zhes bya /
translated: heat is called 'tapa',

original: dka' thub la yang ta pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dka' thub la yang ta pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and austerity is also called 'tapa'.

original: de ltar skad dang gzhung mthun pas dper bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar skad dang gzhung mthun pas dper bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be taken as an example because the language and the text agree.

original: @89b 'dam gyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: @89b 'dam gyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that is like a swamp?

original: bdag nyid kyi nyes pa pha rol la gos par byed pa'o zhes pa ni 'dam gyi sems te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nyes pa pha rol la gos par byed pa'o zhes pa ni 'dam gyi sems te /
translated: It is the one that causes one's own faults to stick to others. This is the mind that is like a swamp.

original: 'dam ni bdag gi ngo bor ngan pa de gzhan la gos shing chags par byed do //
analyzed: 'dam ni bdag gi ngo bor ngan pa de gzhan la gos shing chags par byed do //
translated: Mud is the nature of filth, and it sticks to and adheres to others.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang rang gi nyes pa gzhan la gos par byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang rang gi nyes pa gzhan la gos par byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed do //
translated: In the same way, that mind also sticks to and adheres to others through the Dharma of its own faults.

original: rnyog pa'i sems gang zhe na /üîΩgang pha rol gyi nyes pa byung bas ba dag gi sems 'khrugs par bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni rnyog pa lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: rnyog pa'i sems gang zhe na / gang pha rol gyi nyes pa byung bas ba dag gi sems 'khrugs par bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni rnyog pa lta bu'i sems te /
translated: What is a disturbed mind?üîΩIt is a mind that is disturbed by the faults of others.

original: gzhan gyi nyes pas bdag gi sems 'khrugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyes pas bdag gi sems 'khrugs par byed pa'o //
translated: This is a mind that is like a disturbance, because the faults of others disturb one‚Äôs own mind.

original: kha dog gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a colored mind?

original: gang de nyid kyis chos bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni kha dog lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang de nyid kyis chos bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni kha dog lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is a mind that is colored by the Dharma.

original: tshon dkar po'am dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog ni gang la bskus pa de tshon de nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshon dkar po'am dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog ni gang la bskus pa de tshon de nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: This is a mind that is like a color, because a color such as white or red is the nature of whatever it is applied to.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang gang gi dngos po bsams pa de la zhen ni ji ltar bsams pa de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang gang gi dngos po bsams pa de la zhen ni ji ltar bsams pa de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
translated: Likewise, this mind also is the cultivation of the Dharma in which one is attached to the nature of whatever thing one thinks about, as one thinks about it.

original: phub kyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: phub kyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like a covering?

original: gang dge ba gzhan spong ba'i chos bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni phub lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang dge ba gzhan spong ba'i chos bsnyen pa'o zhes pa ni phub lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The cultivation of the Dharma that abandons other wholesome states.

original: phub ni mtshon la sogs pa gzhan rnams kyis mi phigs par skyob pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: phub ni mtshon la sogs pa gzhan rnams kyis mi phigs par skyob pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: The covering is the action of protecting from other things, such as weapons.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang dge ba gcig spyad pas dge ba gzhan sgrib par byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang dge ba gcig spyad pas dge ba gzhan sgrib par byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
translated: Likewise, this mind also is the cultivation of the Dharma that obscures other wholesome states by practicing one wholesome state.

original: 'khrul pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like a mistake?üîΩThat which grasps one thing and thinks about another.

original: gang gzhan gzung zhing gzhan sems pa'o zhes pa ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
analyzed: gang gzhan gzung zhing gzhan sems pa'o zhes pa ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /
translated: This is the mind that has the nature of a mistake.

original: gang gis dngos po zin te 'khrul nas gzhan yin snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po zin te 'khrul nas gzhan yin snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: That which grasps one thing and thinks about another is a mistake.

original: dug gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: dug gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind like poison?

original: gang shin tu dngos po med par sems pa'o zhes pa ni dug gi sems te /
analyzed: gang shin tu dngos po med par sems pa'o zhes pa ni dug gi sems te /
translated: The thought that is extremely non-substantial is the thought of poison.

original: dug ni gang gis zin na shi ste med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dug ni gang gis zin na shi ste med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Poison is that by which one is seized and dies, becomes non-substantial.

original: de bzhin du sems de gang yang lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas phyir mi skye bar med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de gang yang lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas phyir mi skye bar med par byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, that thought is that by which, having abandoned the afflictions such as views, one becomes non-substantial, not being born again.

original: zhags pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhags pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thought that is a noose?

original: gang thams cad rang 'ching zhing 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni zhags pa lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang thams cad rang 'ching zhing 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni zhags pa lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The thought that is a noose is that by which one remains bound to everything.

original: zhags pa ni 'ching ba'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: zhags pa ni 'ching ba'i bya ba byed do //
translated: A noose is that which performs the action of binding.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid bcing bar byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid bcing bar byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, that thought is that by which one is bound to the Dharma that is to be practiced.

original: lcags sgrog gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: lcags sgrog gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thought that is a fetter?

original: gang rkang pa gnyis la 'dug par sems pa'o zhes pa ni lcags @90a * //
analyzed: gang rkang pa gnyis la 'dug par sems pa'o zhes pa ni lcags @90a * //
translated: The thought that is a fetter is that by which one remains bound to both feet.

original: sgrog lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: sgrog lta bu'i sems te /
translated: A fetter is that which performs the action of binding.

original: lcags sgrog ni rkang pa gnyis 'dzin par byed de de bzhin du sems de yang yod pa dang med pa'i tshig gi mtha' gnyis 'dzin pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: lcags sgrog ni rkang pa gnyis 'dzin par byed de de bzhin du sems de yang yod pa dang med pa'i tshig gi mtha' gnyis 'dzin pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the mind is the Dharma that binds the two extremes of existence and non-existence.

original: de la lcags sgrog rkang gnyis 'dzin pa dang sems kyi mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa ji ltar dper 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la lcags sgrog rkang gnyis 'dzin pa dang sems kyi mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa ji ltar dper 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the fetter that binds the two feet an example for the mind that binds the two extremes?

original: rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit,

original: rkang pa la yang pa da zhes bya /
analyzed: rkang pa la yang pa da zhes bya /
translated: the word for foot is pada.

original: tshig la yang pa da zhes bya ste mthun no //
analyzed: tshig la yang pa da zhes bya ste mthun no //
translated: The word for statement is also pada. It is similar.

original: sprin gyi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: sprin gyi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a cloud-like mind?

original: gang dbyar du sems pa'o zhes pa ni sprin lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang dbyar du sems pa'o zhes pa ni sprin lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the mind that thinks of the rainy season. This is a mind like a cloud.

original: sprin ni dbyar 'du zhing dbyar gyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: sprin ni dbyar 'du zhing dbyar gyi bya ba byed de /
translated: Clouds gather in the rainy season and perform the functions of the rainy season.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang dbyar gyi bya ba byed pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang dbyar gyi bya ba byed pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the mind is the Dharma that performs the functions of the rainy season.

original: zhing gi sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhing gi sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a field-like mind?

original: bdag gi lus la yongs su las byed pa'o zhes pa ni zhing lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la yongs su las byed pa'o zhes pa ni zhing lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the mind that fully engages in one's own body. This is a mind like a field.

original: zhing ni 'brul la sogs pa skye bar byed pa'i phyir rmos pa la sogs pa'i las byi dor byed do //
analyzed: zhing ni 'brul la sogs pa skye bar byed pa'i phyir rmos pa la sogs pa'i las byi dor byed do //
translated: The field is the ground that produces crops such as barley, so it is cultivated by plowing and so on.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi lus bzang por bya ba'i phyir khrus dang byug pa dang rgyan la sogs pas bdag gi lus la brgyan par byed pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi lus bzang por bya ba'i phyir khrus dang byug pa dang rgyan la sogs pas bdag gi lus la brgyan par byed pa'i chos bsnyen pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the mind is the field of the body, so it is cultivated by the Dharma, which adorns the body with bathing, ointments, jewelry and so on in order to make the body beautiful.

original: lan tshva'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: lan tshva'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a salty mind?

original: gang la gang gis bsam pa de nyid sems pa'o zhes pa ni lan tshva'i sems te /
analyzed: gang la gang gis bsam pa de nyid sems pa'o zhes pa ni lan tshva'i sems te /
translated: It is a salty mind that thinks of something with something.

original: lan tshva ni bum pa la sogs pa snod kyi nang du gzhag na snod de yang lan tshvas zos nas byang ste rdol pa dang lan tshva'i ror 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan tshva ni bum pa la sogs pa snod kyi nang du gzhag na snod de yang lan tshvas zos nas byang ste rdol pa dang lan tshva'i ror 'gyur ro //
translated: When salt is placed in a container such as a pot, the pot is eaten by the salt and becomes hollow and salty.

original: de bzhin du sems des kyang gang gi dngos po la dmigs shing rtog pa la rtog pa'i sems de nyid kyis skad cig ma phyi ma'i cha la rtog pa'i de sun phyung nas med par byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems des kyang gang gi dngos po la dmigs shing rtog pa la rtog pa'i sems de nyid kyis skad cig ma phyi ma'i cha la rtog pa'i de sun phyung nas med par byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the mind is the container of the body, so it is cultivated by the Dharma, which is like salt, since the mind itself that observes and conceives of something is destroyed and made to disappear in the next moment by the conception of that thing.

original: spu gri'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: spu gri'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the razor-like thought?

original: gang rab tu byung ba tsam la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni spu gri lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang rab tu byung ba tsam la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni spu gri lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the thought of one who is satisfied with merely being ordained.üîΩThe razor is satisfied with merely shaving the head.

original: spu gri ni rab tu byung ba'i skra 'dreg pa tsam gyi bya ba byed pa de rab tu byung ba ni nan tan gyis gzhan mi byed do //
analyzed: spu gri ni rab tu byung ba'i skra 'dreg pa tsam gyi bya ba byed pa de rab tu byung ba ni nan tan gyis gzhan mi byed do //
translated: The ordained person does not do anything else with effort.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang rab tu byung ste skra 'dreg nas rab tu byung ba tsam la gnas kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang rab tu byung ste skra 'dreg nas rab tu byung ba tsam la gnas kyi /
translated: Similarly, the thought is satisfied with merely being ordained, shaving the head, and remaining ordained.

original: rab tu byung ba'i bslab pa'i nan tan tshul khrims srung ba la sogs pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i bslab pa'i nan tan tshul khrims srung ba la sogs pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: It does not do the practice of the ordained person, such as guarding morality.

original: ri rab tu gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: ri rab tu gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thought that is like Mount Meru?

original: gang che bar gyur pa'i sems pa ni ri rab lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: gang che bar gyur pa'i sems pa ni ri rab lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The thought of one who is great is the thought that is like Mount Meru.

original: ri rab ni dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad cur gyen du mtho zhing 'phags par gyur to /
analyzed: ri rab ni dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad cur gyen du mtho zhing 'phags par gyur to /
translated: Mount Meru is eighty thousand yojanas high and lofty.

original: @90b de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi yon tan gyis kun nas 'phags so snyam nas 'gying zhing che bar byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: @90b de bzhin du sems de yang bdag gi yon tan gyis kun nas 'phags so snyam nas 'gying zhing che bar byed pa'i chos bsnyen par byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the mind also is the one that makes itself great by means of its own qualities, and it is the one that makes itself arrogant.

original: rgya mtshor gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgya mtshor gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ocean-like mind?

original: rang gi lus la rtog cing 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi lus la rtog cing 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: It is the mind that remains contemplating its own body.

original: rgya mtsho lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho lta bu'i sems te /
translated: The ocean-like mind is like the ocean.

original: rgya mtsho ni rang gi rlabs kyis bdag nyid la rlob cing reg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ni rang gi rlabs kyis bdag nyid la rlob cing reg par byed pa'o //
translated: The ocean is the one that is filled and touched by its own waves.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid kyi lus la mi rtag pa dang stong pa la sogs par rtog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang bdag nyid kyi lus la mi rtag pa dang stong pa la sogs par rtog go //
translated: In the same way, the mind also is the one that contemplates its own body as impermanent, empty, etc.

original: phug tu gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: phug tu gyur pa'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cave-like mind?

original: sngon nges par gyur pa las phyis de nyid du 'gyur ba ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni phug lta bu'i sems te /
analyzed: sngon nges par gyur pa las phyis de nyid du 'gyur ba ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni phug lta bu'i sems te /
translated: It is the mind that, having been determined before, shows itself later on in the same way.

original: sems de phug ni sgor chung dur nges pa las gyur pa /
analyzed: sems de phug ni sgor chung dur nges pa las gyur pa /
translated: The cave-like mind is the mind that, having been determined as a small opening in a cave,

original: phug de sgo las rnam ba du mar che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phug de sgo las rnam ba du mar che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: becomes many times greater than the opening of the cave.

original: de bzhin du sems de yang sngar bdag dang tshul khrims dang yon tan dang ldan pas nges par 'jug pa las tshul khrims dang yon tan dang de nyid kyis dregs nas de'i gzhis nga rgyal byed cing 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems de yang sngar bdag dang tshul khrims dang yon tan dang ldan pas nges par 'jug pa las tshul khrims dang yon tan dang de nyid kyis dregs nas de'i gzhis nga rgyal byed cing 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the mind also is previously engaged by possessing self, morality, and virtue, and then through morality, virtue, and that very pride, it is made to turn by the basis of pride.

original: tsher 'gyur ba'i sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: tsher 'gyur ba'i sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is a mind that is inclined?

original: gang gi sems bskyed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi sems bskyed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni //
translated: It is a mind that goes in the same way as the generation of the mind.

original: tsher gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te /üîΩsngon dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yang rung ba la spyad pa'i bag chags yod pas gang du skyes na yang bag chags de nyid lhan cig tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: tsher gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems te / sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yang rung ba la spyad pa'i bag chags yod pas gang du skyes na yang bag chags de nyid lhan cig tu skye ba'o //
translated: This is the nature of a mind that is inclined.üîΩBecause there is a latent tendency for the practice of either virtue or nonvirtue, wherever one is born, that latent tendency is born together with it.

original: yang na sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang yang rung ba'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'i tshe thob nas de lta bu dang lhan cig tu skye ba ste /
analyzed: yang na sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang yang rung ba'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'i tshe thob nas de lta bu dang lhan cig tu skye ba ste /
translated: Or, when the result of the evolution of either virtue or nonvirtue is obtained, it is born together with it.

original: dper na tshe rabs snga ma la srog gcod pa goms shing mang du byas pas tshe phyi ma la nad mang zhing tshe thung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dper na tshe rabs snga ma la srog gcod pa goms shing mang du byas pas tshe phyi ma la nad mang zhing tshe thung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: For example, through the frequent practice of killing in a previous life, one will have many illnesses and a short life in the next life.

original: de bzhin du dge pa yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems brgya drug cu bskal ba gsum 'das pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye'o zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge pa yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems brgya drug cu bskal ba gsum 'das pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye'o zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Similarly, virtue should be applied in the appropriate way.üîΩThe sixty-four supramundane minds arise after three eons have passed.

original: gang zag la bdag med par chud pa'i sems zag pa med pa ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang / chos la bdag med par chud pa'i sems zag pa med par ji bzhin pa med pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /üîΩde la skabs 'dir 'jig rten las ma @91a * //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par chud pa'i sems zag pa med pa ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang / chos la bdag med par chud pa'i sems zag pa med par ji bzhin pa med pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste / de la skabs 'dir 'jig rten las ma @91a * //
translated: Supramundane minds are also of two types: minds that penetrate the selflessness of persons, uncontaminated minds that are as they are, and minds that penetrate the selflessness of phenomena, uncontaminated minds that are not as they are, but are naturally luminous.

original: 'das pa'i sems shes pa ni gang zag rnams kyis shes par nus sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i sems shes pa ni gang zag rnams kyis shes par nus sam zhe na /
translated: Here, the knowledge of supramundane minds is the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: de nas rtog pa can de dag gis mi nus te /
analyzed: de nas rtog pa can de dag gis mi nus te /
translated: Then, those with conceptual thoughts are unable to do so.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rtog pa kun gyi rig dka' ste //
analyzed: rtog pa kun gyi rig dka' ste //
translated: All concepts are difficult to know.

original: zhes pa'o // sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: This is what the previous buddhas taught.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar rtog pa rnams kyis kyang shes par mi nus na sus shes par nus she na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar rtog pa rnams kyis kyang shes par mi nus na sus shes par nus she na /
translated: If it is like that and cannot be known even by those with conceptual thoughts, who then can know it?

original: rtog pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen te gsungs pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen te gsungs pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not the domain of those with conceptual thoughts, but it is known and taught by the BhagavƒÅn Buddhas.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams zhes pa ni de lta bu 'ba' zhig gis bshad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams zhes pa ni de lta bu 'ba' zhig gis bshad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: As for ‚Äúthe previous buddhas,‚Äù it is not only explained like that.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang tshul 'di ltar mkhyen nas bshad pa'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang tshul 'di ltar mkhyen nas bshad pa'o zhes pa ste /
translated: It is also known and explained by the previous buddhas in this way.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mkhyen pa gcig par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mkhyen pa gcig par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that the BhagavƒÅn Buddhas have the same knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / chos kyi sku dang 'gro ba'i don mdzad par gcig pas mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro//
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / chos kyi sku dang 'gro ba'i don mdzad par gcig pas mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro//
translated: because of the sameness of the accumulations of merit and knowledge, the Dharma Body, and the performance of benefit for beings.

original: nyes pa kun dang bral ba'o zhes pa ni de lta bu'i zab cing zhi ba gang zag la bdag med par chud pa de nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o zhes pa'o //üîΩgsang ba'i bdag po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de la gnas nas phung po la sogs pa yod snyam pa'i blo skye ba'o zhes pa ni de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: nyes pa kun dang bral ba'o zhes pa ni de lta bu'i zab cing zhi ba gang zag la bdag med par chud pa de nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o zhes pa'o // gsang ba'i bdag po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de la gnas nas phung po la sogs pa yod snyam pa'i blo skye ba'o zhes pa ni de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa /
translated: It is free from all faults. This means that the profound and peaceful penetration of the selflessness of persons is free from the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: zab cing zhi ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de la gnas na /üîΩgong du smos pa'i tshul du phung po tsam ste /
analyzed: zab cing zhi ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de la gnas na / gong du smos pa'i tshul du phung po tsam ste /
translated: Lord of Secrets, having abided in that supramundane mind, the thought arises that the aggregates and so forth exist. This means that having abided in that profound and peaceful supramundane mind, which is the correct understanding of the selflessness of persons,üîΩthe thought arises that the mere aggregates,

original: yod par rtog gi gang zag la ni bdag med par chud de de ni bskal pa gsum gyi sa rdzogs par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: yod par rtog gi gang zag la ni bdag med par chud de de ni bskal pa gsum gyi sa rdzogs par 'gyur ro//
translated: as previously explained, exist. The selflessness of persons is penetrated, and that is the completion of the grounds in three eons.

original: nam phung po la skyo ba skye ba nas zhes pa nas sbyor ba'i lam rnams bskal pa gcig gis 'das par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni /
analyzed: nam phung po la skyo ba skye ba nas zhes pa nas sbyor ba'i lam rnams bskal pa gcig gis 'das par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúWhen one becomes disenchanted with the aggregates‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe path of preparation is completed in one eon‚Äù explains the path of preparation.

original: de ltar phung po la spyir brtags te /
analyzed: de ltar phung po la spyir brtags te /
translated: Thus, one investigates the aggregates in general.

original: brtags pa de la dngos po yong snyam du blo skyes pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa de la dngos po yong snyam du blo skyes pa'o //
translated: One thinks, ‚ÄúAre they real?‚Äù

original: phung po so sor bshig ste sun phung na gzugs kyi phung po ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra /
analyzed: phung po so sor bshig ste sun phung na gzugs kyi phung po ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra /
translated: When one individually analyzes the aggregates, one thinks, ‚ÄúThe form aggregate is like a ball of foam.‚Äù

original: ji ltar dbu ba la so sor gzhig na /üîΩdbu ba la snying po med pa bzhin du phung po de yang bshig ste so sor brtags na /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ba la so sor gzhig na / dbu ba la snying po med pa bzhin du phung po de yang bshig ste so sor brtags na /
translated: When one individually analyzes foam,üîΩone sees that it has no essence.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa so sor chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid tsam du zad kyi phung po zhes pa'i dngos po gang yang med par shes @91b so ;
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa so sor chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid tsam du zad kyi phung po zhes pa'i dngos po gang yang med par shes @91b so ;
translated: In the same way, when one individually analyzes the aggregates, one sees that they are just the individual characteristics of phenomena, such as color and shape, and one understands that there is no entity at all that is an aggregate.

original: / de bzhin du tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur dang 'dra ste byung ma thag tu zhig cing med par byed par 'gyur ta /
analyzed: / de bzhin du tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur dang 'dra ste byung ma thag tu zhig cing med par byed par 'gyur ta /
translated: Similarly, one thinks, ‚ÄúFeeling is like a water bubble. As soon as it arises, it bursts and disappears.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pas 'dug pa'i gnas med pa la phung por brtags pa'i dngos po gang yang med par shes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pas 'dug pa'i gnas med pa la phung por brtags pa'i dngos po gang yang med par shes so //
translated: Since they are impermanent, there is no place where they abide. One should understand that there is no entity whatsoever that is imputed as a skandha.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang so sor bshig na rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang so sor bshig na rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: In the same way, when the consciousness skandha is individually broken down, consciousness is like an illusion.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i ba lang la sogs te /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i ba lang la sogs te /
translated: Just as an illusory ox, etc.

original: de dag la ba lang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag la ba lang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: An ox does not exist in that,

original: rtsi shing la sogs pa de rnams kyi rang bzhin du zad do //
analyzed: rtsi shing la sogs pa de rnams kyi rang bzhin du zad do //
translated: but it is simply the nature of grass, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang de 'dra ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po yang de 'dra ste /
translated: The consciousness skandha is also like that.

original: phung po brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin de tsam du zad do //
analyzed: phung po brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin de tsam du zad do //
translated: The entity that is imputed as a skandha does not exist, but it is simply the nature of consciousness.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po lnga yang so sor gzhig na smig rgyu ba 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po lnga yang so sor gzhig na smig rgyu ba 'dra ste /
translated: When the five skandhas of discrimination are individually broken down, they are like a mirage.

original: ji ltar smig rgyu ba la skom pas gdungs pa'i skyes bus chur mthong mod kyi de la chu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar smig rgyu ba la skom pas gdungs pa'i skyes bus chur mthong mod kyi de la chu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as a person tormented by thirst sees water in a mirage, but there is no entity of water in that,

original: smig rgyu ba'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: smig rgyu ba'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: It is nothing but the nature of a mirage.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po yang de dang 'dra ste ;
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po yang de dang 'dra ste ;
translated: The same is true of the aggregate of perception.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po brtags pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin gyi de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po brtags pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin gyi de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: The entity that is investigated as the aggregate of perception does not exist. It is nothing but the nature of apprehending the signs of objects.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi phung po yang chu shing gi phung po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi phung po yang chu shing gi phung po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The same is true of the aggregate of formation. It is like a plantain tree.

original: kun du grags pas 'dir ma smos so //
analyzed: kun du grags pas 'dir ma smos so //
translated: It is well known, so it is not mentioned here.

original: de ltar phung po de yang dbu ba la sogs pa'i dpes sun phyung nas phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod par mi 'gyur te so so'i mtshan nyid du zad do //
analyzed: de ltar phung po de yang dbu ba la sogs pa'i dpes sun phyung nas phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod par mi 'gyur te so so'i mtshan nyid du zad do //
translated: Thus, after refuting the aggregates with the examples of foam and so on, the entity that is imputed as the aggregates does not exist. It is nothing but the individual characteristics of the aggregates.

original: de ltar phung po yod par ma grub na khams dang skye mched rnams kyang phung po las mi gzhan pas na khams dang skye mched du brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar phung po yod par ma grub na khams dang skye mched rnams kyang phung po las mi gzhan pas na khams dang skye mched du brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If the aggregates are not established as existing in that way, the constituents and sources do not exist separately from the aggregates. Therefore, the entity that is imputed as the constituents and sources does not exist.

original: de rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: They are nothing but the individual natures of those.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang gzugs kyi phung po ni gzung ba'i dngos por brtags /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang gzugs kyi phung po ni gzung ba'i dngos por brtags /
translated: The form aggregate is imputed as the object of apprehension.üîΩThe four aggregates of feeling, etc., are imputed as the apprehender.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi ni 'dzin par brtags pa'i dngos po yang brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te chos rnams so so'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi ni 'dzin par brtags pa'i dngos po yang brtags pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te chos rnams so so'i rang bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: The object of imputation does not exist, for phenomena are exhausted as mere individual natures.

original: de ltar phung po la skyo ba'i sems skyes pas dbu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du bshig cing bsgoms nas phung po la yod do snyam du blo skyes nas phung por 'dzin pa de las kyang grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar phung po la skyo ba'i sems skyes pas dbu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du bshig cing bsgoms nas phung po la yod do snyam du blo skyes nas phung por 'dzin pa de las kyang grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the mind is disgusted with the aggregates, one meditates on them as having the nature of foam, etc., and having been liberated from the apprehension of the aggregates, one thinks, ‚ÄúThe aggregates exist.‚Äù

original: nam phung po la skyo ba'i sems skyes nas de ni dbu ba dang chu bur dang sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang @92a * //üîΩ'dra bar rnam par bsgoms pas rnam par grol lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nam phung po la skyo ba'i sems skyes nas de ni dbu ba dang chu bur dang sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang @92a * //üîΩ'dra bar rnam par bsgoms pas rnam par grol lo zhes pa'o //
translated: When the mind is disgusted with the aggregates, one meditates on them as being like foam, bubbles, a mirage, a plantain tree, and an illusion, and one is liberated.

original: de ltar phung po las rnam par grol nas chos rnams kyi ngo bo rang bzhin phung po la sogs par brtags pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid tsam 'ba' zhig yod par chud par gzhung las gsungs pa de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar phung po las rnam par grol nas chos rnams kyi ngo bo rang bzhin phung po la sogs par brtags pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid tsam 'ba' zhig yod par chud par gzhung las gsungs pa de 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, having been freed from the aggregates, the scriptures state that one will understand that the nature of phenomena is only the mere characteristics free from the imputations of the aggregates and so on.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang rnam par bral ba chos nyid kyi rang bzhin ni zhi ba'i khams te rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang rnam par bral ba chos nyid kyi rang bzhin ni zhi ba'i khams te rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
