translated: The nature of dharmatƒÅ, free from the aggregates, elements, sense sources, percepts, and perceivers, is the peace of dhƒÅtu.

original: de la phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba zhes pa ni gong du phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po sun phyung ba'i tshul gyis chos nyid kyi rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa'i ji bzhin pa laüîΩbrtags pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin pas na bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba zhes pa ni gong du phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po sun phyung ba'i tshul gyis chos nyid kyi rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa'i ji bzhin pa laüîΩbrtags pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin pas na bral ba'o //
translated: In this context, ‚Äúfree from the aggregates, elements, sense sources, percepts, and perceivers‚Äù means that since the nature of dharmatƒÅ is free from the imputed entities of the aggregates and so on, it is free from the entities imputed as the suchness of blue and so on.

original: de bas na gzung 'dzin dang bral ba zhes pas yang gzugs kyi phung po la gzung bar brtags pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi la 'dzin pa'i dngos por brtags pa de dang bral ba la bya'i //
analyzed: de bas na gzung 'dzin dang bral ba zhes pas yang gzugs kyi phung po la gzung bar brtags pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi la 'dzin pa'i dngos por brtags pa de dang bral ba la bya'i //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúfree from the apprehended and apprehender‚Äù means free from the imputation of the form aggregate as the apprehended and the imputation of the four aggregates beginning with feeling as the entity of the apprehender.

original: chos la bdag med par chung ba'i mtshan nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par chung ba'i mtshan nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba la ni mi bya'o //
translated: It does not mean free from the selflessness of phenomena, the characteristic of the absence of the apprehended and apprehender.üîΩThe nature of reality

original: chos nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa ni /
translated: The nature of reality is as follows.

original: de la chos ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Dharma refers to the aggregates and so on.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo ni chos nyid kyi rang bzhin te ;
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo ni chos nyid kyi rang bzhin te ;
translated: The nature of those is the nature of reality.

original: de yang sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: de yang sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Moreover, those are the natures of blue, red, and so on.

original: de ltar sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsam 'ba' zhig yod kyi phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por brtags pa'i dngos po med par chud ba ni zhi ba'i khams rtogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsam 'ba' zhig yod kyi phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por brtags pa'i dngos po med par chud ba ni zhi ba'i khams rtogs zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, only the mere natures of blue, red, and so on exist. Understanding that the entity imputed as the entity of the aggregates and so on does not exist is called ‚Äúrealizing the element of peace.‚Äù

original: zhi ba zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyu de la phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i 'khrul pa med pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes pa ni sems kyi rgyu de la phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i 'khrul pa med pas zhi ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPeace‚Äù means that the mind is at peace because there is no confusion that imputes the aggregates and so forth to that cause of the mind.

original: khams ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khams ni rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúConstituent‚Äù means nature.

original: rtogs pa ni de lta bu'i tshul du chud pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni de lta bu'i tshul du chud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization‚Äù means to penetrate in that way.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de ni log pa dang ma log pa brgyad kyis sems kyi rim pa dang 'brel pas las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgya mtsho dang bral ba sbyor ba rnams bskal pa gcig gis 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de ni log pa dang ma log pa brgyad kyis sems kyi rim pa dang 'brel pas las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgya mtsho dang bral ba sbyor ba rnams bskal pa gcig gis 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni
translated: ‚ÄúLord of Secrets, that supramundane mind is connected with the stages of the mind through the eight reversals and nonreversals, and thus those who are free from the ocean of karma and afflictions will transcend the stages in one eon.‚Äù

original: phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod par 'dzin pa las grol nas chos rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin tsam 'ba' zhig yod par chud pa'i sems zhi ba de phung po la dngos po @92b med pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: phung por brtags pa'i dngos po yod par 'dzin pa las grol nas chos rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin tsam 'ba' zhig yod par chud pa'i sems zhi ba de phung po la dngos po @92b med pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Having been liberated from the apprehension of the existence of things imputed as the aggregates and so forth, the mind that has penetrated the mere existence of the individual natures of phenomena is a peaceful mind.

original: chos rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad par chud pa la zhugs nas bskal pa gcig gis sems de nyid las 'das te chos la bdag med par chud pa mos pa spyod pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad par chud pa la zhugs nas bskal pa gcig gis sems de nyid las 'das te chos la bdag med par chud pa mos pa spyod pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having entered into the individual natures of phenomena, such as blue and so on, they transcend that mind in one eon and enter into the stage of devoted engagement, which is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de ni log pa dang ma log pa brgyad kyis sems kyi rim pa shes pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar gyis sems brgyad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de ni log pa dang ma log pa brgyad kyis sems kyi rim pa shes pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar gyis sems brgyad pa la bya ste /
translated: The supramundane mind is the eight minds of reversal and nonreversal. The mind of the eight stages from stream entry to arhat is the eighth mind.

original: sems de dag log pa dang ma log pa'i phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po yod par 'dzin pas log pa'o//
analyzed: sems de dag log pa dang ma log pa'i phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po yod par 'dzin pas log pa'o//
translated: Those minds are reversed because they apprehend the aggregates and so on as existing things that are either reversed or not reversed.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pas na ma log pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pas na ma log pa'o //
translated: They are not reversed because they abandon the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pas na log pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pas na log pa'o //
translated: They are reversed because they possess the imprints of the afflictions.

original: rnam par 'brel ba zhes pa ni phung po la bdag med par chud pa'i sems zhi ba de /
analyzed: rnam par 'brel ba zhes pa ni phung po la bdag med par chud pa'i sems zhi ba de /
translated: The mind that is pacified and enters into the selflessness of the aggregates is the mind of nonreversal.

original: phung po la yod par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis rim pa brgyad po des bskyed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: phung po la yod par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis rim pa brgyad po des bskyed pa la bya ste /
translated: The mind that apprehends the aggregates as existing is generated by these eight stages.

original: de lta bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de log pa dang ma log pa brgyad kyis sems kyi rim pa dang rnam par 'brel pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems de log pa dang ma log pa brgyad kyis sems kyi rim pa dang rnam par 'brel pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the transcendent mind is said to be related to the stages and aspects of the mind, which are eightfold, in terms of whether it is reversed or not.

original: de dag gi sngags kyi sgor spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po rnams gang zag la bdag med par chud pa'i rim gyis sems brgya drug cu la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spyod pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sngags kyi sgor spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po rnams gang zag la bdag med par chud pa'i rim gyis sems brgya drug cu la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spyod pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: These are the stages of the bodhisattvas of dull faculties who practice the mantra vehicle, who, by the stage of entering into the selflessness of the person, engage in the afflictions of the one hundred and sixty mental states and so on.

original: da ni sngags kyi sgor spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen pos 'gro ba gzhan gyi rkyen gyis ma yin pa shes rab rnon po rnams chos dang gang zag gnyis ka la bdag med par bsgom zhing mos pa spyod pa'i sa la 'jug pa'iüîΩrim pa bshad de /
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi sgor spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen pos 'gro ba gzhan gyi rkyen gyis ma yin pa shes rab rnon po rnams chos dang gang zag gnyis ka la bdag med par bsgom zhing mos pa spyod pa'i sa la 'jug pa'iüîΩrim pa bshad de /
translated: Now, the stages of entering the level of resolute practice of the bodhisattvas of sharp faculties who practice the mantra vehicle, who are not dependent on the conditions of others, who are MahƒÅyƒÅna practitioners, and who meditate on the selflessness of both persons and phenomena, will be explained.

original: de yang gsang ba'i bdag po theg pa chen por zhugs pa gzhan gyi rkyen gyis ma yin chos la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du sems skye'o //
analyzed: de yang gsang ba'i bdag po theg pa chen por zhugs pa gzhan gyi rkyen gyis ma yin chos la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du sems skye'o //
translated: Moreover, the Lord of Secrets, the bodhisattva who has entered the Great Vehicle, generates the mind that is the nature of the selflessness of phenomena, not by the condition of another.

original: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la zhugs pa thos pa rab tu mang zhing shes rab mchog tu rno ba gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi gos par rang gi blos chos rnams sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes nas chos la bdag med par chud par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la zhugs pa thos pa rab tu mang zhing shes rab mchog tu rno ba gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi gos par rang gi blos chos rnams sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes nas chos la bdag med par chud par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered the Great Vehicle, who has heard much, whose supreme wisdom is sharp, who is not sullied by the condition of another, who understands phenomena with his own mind as having the characteristics of illusions, mirages, and so on, will penetrate the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med par chud pa'i rim pa bskal pa gsum gyis 'da' bar bya ba dang / @93a * //
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med par chud pa'i rim pa bskal pa gsum gyis 'da' bar bya ba dang / @93a * //
translated: In that regard, the stage of penetrating the selflessness of the person is to be transcended in three eons.

original: gang zag la bdag med pas kyang phung po tsam yod par 'du shes pa yang bskal pa gcig gis spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pas kyang phung po tsam yod par 'du shes pa yang bskal pa gcig gis spang bar bya'o //
translated: Also, the perception that the mere aggregates exist due to the selflessness of the person is to be abandoned in one eon.

original: dgos na de dag gi bya ba ma byas par ji ltar chos la bdag med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dgos na de dag gi bya ba ma byas par ji ltar chos la bdag med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is necessary, how can the selflessness of phenomena be generated without performing the activities of those?

original: gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni de dag gi sngon spyad pa na phung po dang kun gzhi bsgoms pas ngo bo nyid yongs su rig pa ni /
analyzed: de ni de dag gi sngon spyad pa na phung po dang kun gzhi bsgoms pas ngo bo nyid yongs su rig pa ni /
translated: Because they previously cultivated the aggregates and the foundation consciousness.

original: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / me mgal bskor ba dang / dri zi'i grong khyer lta bu'i 'du shes skye'o zhes pa ni /üîΩsngon du spyad pa spyod pa na phung po'i gnas bsgoms nas sgyu ma dang smig rgyu ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni dang po'i dad pa rtsol ba'i 'jug pa spyod pa spyad pa na /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / me mgal bskor ba dang / dri zi'i grong khyer lta bu'i 'du shes skye'o zhes pa ni / sngon du spyad pa spyod pa na phung po'i gnas bsgoms nas sgyu ma dang smig rgyu ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni dang po'i dad pa rtsol ba'i 'jug pa spyod pa spyad pa na /
translated: The understanding of their essence is the arising of the perception of illusions, mirages, reflections, echoes, fire wheels, and gandharva cities.üîΩWhen previously practicing, they meditate on the abode of the aggregates and understand the nature of the aggregates to be like illusions, mirages, and so on.

original: phung po'i rang bzhin sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur shes shing goms par byas pas gang zag la bdag med par chud pa'i rim pa ma spyad kyang chos la bdag med par chud par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i rang bzhin sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur shes shing goms par byas pas gang zag la bdag med par chud pa'i rim pa ma spyad kyang chos la bdag med par chud par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: When they engage in the practice of the initial faith and effort, by becoming familiar with the understanding that the aggregates are like illusions and so on, they enter into the selflessness of persons.

original: de la sgyu ma zhes pa ni chos rnams la sgyu ma lta bur 'du shes skyes te /
analyzed: de la sgyu ma zhes pa ni chos rnams la sgyu ma lta bur 'du shes skyes te /
translated: In that regard, illusion means that the perception of phenomena as illusions arises.

original: sgyu ma'i ba lang dang / rta la sogs pa rdo dang / shing la sogs pa la byas kyang rdo shing rnams su mi mngon par ba lang dang / rta la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang mod kyi //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i ba lang dang / rta la sogs pa rdo dang / shing la sogs pa la byas kyang rdo shing rnams su mi mngon par ba lang dang / rta la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang mod kyi //
translated: Even though an illusory cow, horse, and so on are created from stone, wood, and so on, the form of a cow, horse, and so on does not appear as stone and wood.

original: yang dag par na ba lang dang ; rta la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par na ba lang dang ; rta la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, the entities of a cow, horse, and so on do not exist.

original: rdo shing la sogs pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: rdo shing la sogs pa tsam du zad do //
translated: They are simply stone, wood, and so on.

original: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snad yang rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa'i dbang gis snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snad yang rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa'i dbang gis snang ste /
translated: In the same way, although phenomena such as the aggregates appear, they appear due to the power of the delusion of consciousness.

original: yang dag par ni chos kyi ngo bo sgyu ma'i ba lang dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yang dag par ni chos kyi ngo bo sgyu ma'i ba lang dang 'dra ste /
translated: In reality, the entity of phenomena is like an illusory cow.

original: snang du zin kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang du zin kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though it appears, it does not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni rdo dang shing la sogs pa mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni rdo dang shing la sogs pa mi 'dra ste /
translated: That consciousness is not like stone, wood, and so on.

original: mi mngon yang gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i chos rnams ni yod pa ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i 'khrul pa ji bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: mi mngon yang gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i chos rnams ni yod pa ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i 'khrul pa ji bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: Although it is not apparent, phenomena such as form that appear are not existent. They are simply the delusion of consciousness just as it is.

original: de bzhin du smig rgyu ba dang 'brog dgon pa na skyes bu skom gyis gdungs pas smig rgyu ba la chur mthong ste chu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi smig rgyu tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du smig rgyu ba dang 'brog dgon pa na skyes bu skom gyis gdungs pas smig rgyu ba la chur mthong ste chu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi smig rgyu tsam du zad do //
translated: Likewise, in a mirage or in a desert, a person tormented by thirst sees a mirage as water, but there is no real water there; it is just a mirage.

original: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Likewise, the appearance of phenomena such as the aggregates is not real.

original: rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa ji bzhin tsam du zad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa ji bzhin tsam du zad do //
translated: It is just the error of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / @93b me mgal bskor ba dang / dri za'i grong khyer rnams kyang gong du sgyu ma la sogs pa bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / @93b me mgal bskor ba dang / dri za'i grong khyer rnams kyang gong du sgyu ma la sogs pa bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, reflections, echoes, a fire-wheel, and a gandharva-city should be understood in the same way as illusions and so on were explained above.

original: mdor na phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang ba rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa snang pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: mdor na phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang ba rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa snang pa tsam du zad do //
translated: In brief, the appearance of phenomena such as the aggregates is just the appearance of the error of consciousness.

original: rmi lam na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med par yang gzugs la sogs par mthong zhing /
analyzed: rmi lam na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med par yang gzugs la sogs par mthong zhing /
translated: In a dream, one sees forms and so on without there being objects such as forms.

original: de dag gi bya ba byed mod kyi rmi lam gyi tshe na gzugs la sogs pa med par gsal bar mngon te /üîΩde dag kun rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis gyur pa tsam du zad do snyam nas de ltar mos pa spyod pa'i sa la zhugs nas phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ni bdag med par chud pa ni sgyu ma la sogs pa nas dri za'i grong
analyzed: de dag gi bya ba byed mod kyi rmi lam gyi tshe na gzugs la sogs pa med par gsal bar mngon te / de dag kun rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis gyur pa tsam du zad do snyam nas de ltar mos pa spyod pa'i sa la zhugs nas phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ni bdag med par chud pa ni sgyu ma la sogs pa nas dri za'i grong
translated: Although they perform their functions, it is clear that forms and so on do not exist in dreams.üîΩThinking that they are merely transformations of consciousness, they enter the level of practice with devoted interest and understand that the aggregates and so on are devoid of self.

original: khyer la sogs pa lta bu'i 'du shes skyes te /
analyzed: khyer la sogs pa lta bu'i 'du shes skyes te /
translated: They then develop the perception that they are like illusions and so on, up to like the cities of the gandharvas.

original: chos rnams ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: chos rnams ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: They think, ‚ÄúPhenomena do not exist in reality.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'dzin to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'dzin to //
translated: However, consciousness alone exists.‚Äù

original: de lta bur chos la bdag med par chud pa mos pa spyod pa'i sa de la yang de lta bur chos rnams sgyu ma dang smig rgyu ba la sogs pa'i tshul du 'jug cing 'jug pa'i sems dang / chos rnams de ltar bshig nas de'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: de lta bur chos la bdag med par chud pa mos pa spyod pa'i sa de la yang de lta bur chos rnams sgyu ma dang smig rgyu ba la sogs pa'i tshul du 'jug cing 'jug pa'i sems dang / chos rnams de ltar bshig nas de'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa'i sems dang /
translated: On the level of earnest aspiration, bodhisattvas have thus realized the absence of self in phenomena and they have the three kinds of mental states that are involved in this realization.

original: de nas snying rje'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par spyod cing sa bcu pa la sogs pa yon tan thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis shes nas de dag la rab tu mos pa byed cing 'jug pa dang
analyzed: de nas snying rje'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par spyod cing sa bcu pa la sogs pa yon tan thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis shes nas de dag la rab tu mos pa byed cing 'jug pa dang
translated: They have the mental state of engaging in the practice of the transcendent perfections and so on, on the ten levels and so forth, by listening to, reflecting on and meditating on the wisdom that knows the qualities of those levels and perfections and by having the interest and engaging in them.üîΩThey have the mental state of resting in the nonconceptual concentration that comes from having analyzed phenomena in this way.üîΩAnd they have the mental state of the power of compassion, which makes them practice the transcendent perfections and so on.

original: gnas pa dang ldang ba'i sems de gsum rnam par bsgoms pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan la sogs pa rnams yongs su mi shes pa ni yongs su shes /
analyzed: gnas pa dang ldang ba'i sems de gsum rnam par bsgoms pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan la sogs pa rnams yongs su mi shes pa ni yongs su shes /
translated: By training in these three mental states, they know completely what they did not previously know, the qualities of the levels, transcendent perfections and so forth.

original: mngon du ma byas pa mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis chos la bdag med par chud cing rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'dzin pa de ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid de mos pa spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig
analyzed: mngon du ma byas pa mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis chos la bdag med par chud cing rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'dzin pa de ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid de mos pa spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig
translated: The stage of engagement through belief is characterized by the non-manifestation of the wisdom of listening, reflection, and meditation, and by the retention of the existence of mere consciousness that has penetrated the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: That stage of engagement through belief is completed in one eon.

original: de nas bskal pa bzhi cha gcig gis mos pa spyod pa'i sa de nas 'phar te /
analyzed: de nas bskal pa bzhi cha gcig gis mos pa spyod pa'i sa de nas 'phar te /
translated: Then, in one-fourth of an eon, one rises from that stage of engagement through belief.

original: ye shes kyis de la 'jug pa'i rim pa gsungs pa ste /üîΩde lta bas na gsang ba'i bdag po de dag gis bdag gi sems dbang du gyur pas rang gi sems thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos @94a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyis de la 'jug pa'i rim pa gsungs pa ste / de lta bas na gsang ba'i bdag po de dag gis bdag gi sems dbang du gyur pas rang gi sems thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos @94a * //
translated: The stages of entering that wisdom are taught.

original: la bdag med pa nyid spangs so //
analyzed: la bdag med pa nyid spangs so //
translated: Therefore, O Lord of Secrets, since one‚Äôs mind is under one‚Äôs control, one‚Äôs mind is primordially unborn, and therefore one abandons the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsang ba'i bdag po sems kyi ngo bo nyid rig pas thog ma'i mtha' dang / tha ma'i mtha' yang mi rnyed do //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po sems kyi ngo bo nyid rig pas thog ma'i mtha' dang / tha ma'i mtha' yang mi rnyed do //
translated: O Lord of Secrets, by knowing the essence of the mind, one does not find the beginning or end.

original: de'i sbyor ba rnams kyis bskal pa gnyis kyis 'da'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba rnams kyis bskal pa gnyis kyis 'da'o zhes pa'o //
translated: By the practice of that, he passes beyond in two eons.

original: de la bdag gi sems dbang du gyur pas rang gi sems thog ma nas skyes pa'i phyir chos la bdag med pa nyid kyang spangs so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la bdag gi sems dbang du gyur pas rang gi sems thog ma nas skyes pa'i phyir chos la bdag med pa nyid kyang spangs so zhes pa ni /
translated: There, having gained control over his mind, he also abandons the idea of the selflessness of dharmas, because he understands that his own mind is beginningless.

original: sngar chos la bdag med par chud de /
analyzed: sngar chos la bdag med par chud de /
translated: Previously, he understood the selflessness of dharmas.

original: rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ji bzhin pa yod par sems pa de yang rang gi dbang du gyur pas rnam par shes pa de thog ma nas ma skyes par chud pas rnam par shes pa tsam du byed par 'du shes pa de
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ji bzhin pa yod par sems pa de yang rang gi dbang du gyur pas rnam par shes pa de thog ma nas ma skyes par chud pas rnam par shes pa tsam du byed par 'du shes pa de
translated: He thought that only consciousness, just as it is, exists as subject and object. But that also, having gained control over it, he abandons the idea of consciousness-only, because he understands that consciousness is beginningless and unarisen.

original: yang spangs pas chos la bdag med pa nyid kyang spangs so //
analyzed: yang spangs pas chos la bdag med pa nyid kyang spangs so //
translated: He also abandons the idea of the selflessness of dharmas, because he abandons that idea of consciousness-only.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa tsam du 'du shes pa de spangs pas chos la bdag med pa spangs zhes bya zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa tsam du 'du shes pa de spangs pas chos la bdag med pa spangs zhes bya zhe na //
translated: Why is it said that by abandoning the idea of consciousness-only, he abandons the idea of the selflessness of dharmas?

original: phung po la sogs pa rnams bdag med par chud pa'i rgyus rnam par shes pa tsam du yod par 'du shes skyes te de bas na rnam par shes ba tsam yod par 'du shes pa de spangs na chos la bdag med pa nyid spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams bdag med par chud pa'i rgyus rnam par shes pa tsam du yod par 'du shes skyes te de bas na rnam par shes ba tsam yod par 'du shes pa de spangs na chos la bdag med pa nyid spangs pa yin te /
translated: By the cause of understanding the aggregates and so forth to be selfless, the idea that consciousness alone exists arises. Therefore, if one abandons the idea that consciousness alone exists, one abandons the idea of selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'bras bu la rgyus bslan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu la rgyus bslan pa'o //
translated: This is a case of applying the cause to the effect.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa de yang ji ltar spong zhen /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa de yang ji ltar spong zhen /
translated: How does one abandon the idea that consciousness alone exists?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gsungs pa / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsang ba'i bdag po sems kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su rig pas thog ma'i mtha' dang / tha ma'i mtha' yang mi rnyed do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po sems kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su rig pas thog ma'i mtha' dang / tha ma'i mtha' yang mi rnyed do zhes pa ste /
translated: Lord of Secrets, by thoroughly knowing the essence of mind, one does not find an initial limit or a final limit.

original: de ltar rang gi sems de thog mar gang nas skyes pa'i mtha' btsal na mtha' de mi rnyed de /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi sems de thog mar gang nas skyes pa'i mtha' btsal na mtha' de mi rnyed de /
translated: Thus, if one searches for the limit from which one‚Äôs mind was originally produced, one does not find that limit.

original: de ltar thog ma'i mtha' med pas tha ma 'gag pa'i mtha' yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar thog ma'i mtha' med pas tha ma 'gag pa'i mtha' yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since there is no initial limit in that way, one also does not find a final limit of cessation.

original: thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' mi rnyed do //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' mi rnyed do //
translated: One does not find an initial or final limit.

original: de ltar thog ma'i mtha' med pas sems de ma skyes par mngon te /
analyzed: de ltar thog ma'i mtha' med pas sems de ma skyes par mngon te /
translated: Thus, since there is no beginning, the mind is seen as unborn.üîΩIf it is unborn from the beginning, what is there that is known as the perception of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, which appear as they are?

original: de ltar thog ma nas ma skyes na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ji bzhin par snang bar shes pa de dag ci zhig yod snyam nas dam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa de spangs pas chos la bdag med par yang spangs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thog ma nas ma skyes na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ji bzhin par snang bar shes pa de dag ci zhig yod snyam nas dam par shes pa tsam yod par 'du shes pa de spangs pas chos la bdag med par yang spangs zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the mere perception of the highest truth is abandoned. By abandoning that, the selflessness of phenomena is also abandoned.

original: de lta bu'i tshul du bsgom zhing chos la bdag med par spong ba yang bskal pa gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul du bsgom zhing chos la bdag med par spong ba yang bskal pa gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the meditation and the abandonment of the selflessness of phenomena is completed in two eons.

original: da ni rab tu dga' ba'i byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i rim pa bshad par bya @94b ste ;
analyzed: da ni rab tu dga' ba'i byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i rim pa bshad par bya @94b ste ;
translated: Now, the stages of the arising of the supreme joy of the mind of enlightenment will be explained.

original: de yang gzhan yang gsang ba'i bdag po byang chub sems dpa' sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med grangs med pa'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du tshad med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsagsüîΩpa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de yang gzhan yang gsang ba'i bdag po byang chub sems dpa' sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med grangs med pa'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du tshad med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Furthermore, O Lord of Secrets, bodhisattvas who practice the bodhisattva deeds by way of mantra gather the accumulations of immeasurable merit and wisdom for immeasurable, countless hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of eons.üîΩüîΩ

original: shin tu rang bzhin med pa'i sems skyes te /üîΩgsang ba'i bdag po de ni byang chub kyi sems dang po zhes rgyal ba rnams kyis gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rang bzhin med pa'i sems skyes te / gsang ba'i bdag po de ni byang chub kyi sems dang po zhes rgyal ba rnams kyis gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du sa dang po'i byang chub kyi sems de'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: and the thought that is utterly devoid of intrinsic existence arises.üîΩO Lord of Secrets, the victors have said that this is the first thought of awakening.

original: mtshan nyid de'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni bshad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni bshad par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the perfect cause of the thought of awakening on the first bodhisattva level, the perfect nature of that thought, the perfect characteristics of that thought and the perfect accomplishment of those characteristics should be understood to be explained in the passage from the Compendium of Principles Tantra cited above.

original: de la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni tshad med grangs med pa'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du tshad med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgags pa zhes bya'o //üîΩrang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ni tshad med pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni tshad med grangs med pa'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du tshad med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgags pa zhes bya'o // rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ni tshad med pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa zhes pa nas /
translated: The perfection of cause is called ‚Äúthe accumulation of immeasurable merit and knowledge for immeasurable, countless hundreds of thousands of millions of eons.‚Äù

original: dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pas zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pas zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The perfection of nature is from ‚Äúembraced by immeasurable wisdom‚Äù up to ‚Äúworshipped by the lords of gods, the lords of nagas, and so forth.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa des kyang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang yang bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa des kyang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang yang bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: And that perfection of nature is also to be included in the perfection of abandonment.

original: spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ni tshad med pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyis zin pa zhes pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das zhes pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ni tshad med pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyis zin pa zhes pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das zhes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of abandonment is from ‚Äúembraced by immeasurable wisdom and means‚Äù up to ‚Äútranscending the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.‚Äù

original: mthu phun sum tshogs pa ni lha dang lha ma yin dang 'jig rten du bcas pas phyag byas pa zhes pa dang brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mthu phun sum tshogs pa ni lha dang lha ma yin dang 'jig rten du bcas pas phyag byas pa zhes pa dang brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of power is indicated by the phrase he is worshipped by gods, titans, and the world and by the phrase he is worshipped by Indra, Brahma, the Lord of the Sahaloka, and the other lords.

original: mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni shin tu rang bzhin med pa'i sems skyes zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni shin tu rang bzhin med pa'i sems skyes zhes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of characteristics is indicated by the phrase he is born with a mind that is utterly devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: mtshan nyid de sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni de la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni de la 'di lta ste /
translated: The perfection of the realization of those characteristics is indicated by the phrase he is born in this way.

original: stod pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rdzas ma yin pa zhes pa nas mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid dang bral ba zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: stod pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rdzas ma yin pa zhes pa nas mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid dang bral ba zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The perfection of the absence of intrinsic reality is indicated by the phrase he is not made of material elements up to the phrase he is free from eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de la tshad med pa grangs med pa'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du tshad med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa zhes pa /
analyzed: de la tshad med pa grangs med pa'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du tshad med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa zhes pa /
translated: The perfection of the accumulation of merit and knowledge is indicated by the phrase he has accumulated the immeasurable accumulations of merit and knowledge for immeasurable hundreds of thousands of millions of eons.

original: bskal pa bye ba zhes pa ni 'bum phrag brgya la bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba zhes pa ni 'bum phrag brgya la bya'o //
translated: Millions of eons means hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: brgya stong zhes pa ni bye ba khri phrag 'bum la bya'o //üîΩtshad @95a * //
analyzed: brgya stong zhes pa ni bye ba khri phrag 'bum la bya'o // tshad @95a * //
translated: The terms ‚Äúhundreds of thousands‚Äù and ‚Äúmillions‚Äù refer to ten million.

original: med grangs med ces pa ni bskal pa bye ba phrag 'bum po de yang tshad kyis gzhal du med /
analyzed: med grangs med ces pa ni bskal pa bye ba phrag 'bum po de yang tshad kyis gzhal du med /
translated: ‚ÄúImmeasurable‚Äù and ‚Äúincalculable‚Äù refer to the fact that those hundreds of thousands of millions of eons cannot be measured or counted.

original: grangs med bgrang du med par sems dang po bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: grangs med bgrang du med par sems dang po bskyed pa'am /
translated: From the first generation of the thought of awakening,

original: gang zag la bdag med par bsgoms pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par bsgoms pa nas brtsams te /
translated: or from the cultivation of the selflessness of persons,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyus sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i sems shin tu rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //üîΩtshad med pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa zhes pa shes rab kyi chos thams cad rang bzhin kun chub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyus sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i sems shin tu rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro // tshad med pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa zhes pa shes rab kyi chos thams cad rang bzhin kun chub par byed pa'o //
translated: through the cause of accumulating the collections of merit and wisdom, the first ground, the Joyful, is perfected, which has the characteristic of being utterly devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: thabs ni snying rje chen po'i dbang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang grol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: thabs ni snying rje chen po'i dbang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang grol bar byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSubsumed by immeasurable wisdom and method‚Äù means that wisdom is the realization of the nature of all phenomena, and method is the ripening and liberation of sentient beings through the power of great compassion.

original: tshad med pa zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs de dag nyid 'di tsam zhig ces dpag tu med do //
analyzed: tshad med pa zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs de dag nyid 'di tsam zhig ces dpag tu med do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimmeasurable‚Äù means that those very wisdom and means are immeasurable in that they cannot be measured as being ‚Äújust this much.‚Äù

original: de ltar shes rab kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med par chud pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa dang / thabs kyis sems can smin cing grol bar byed pas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med par chud pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa dang / thabs kyis sems can smin cing grol bar byed pas /
translated: Thus, because of wisdom, one has eliminated afflictions and so forth by realizing that all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic existence, and because of means, one ripens and liberates sentient beings.

original: ngan song la sogs pa spangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas /
analyzed: ngan song la sogs pa spangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas /
translated: Thus, because one possesses the qualities of having eliminated the lower realms and so forth,

original: de'i spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: one‚Äôs elimination is perfect.

original: yongs su zin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su zin zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcompletely embraced‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi sems de de lta bu shes rab dang thabs tshad med pa spong ba phun sum tshogs pa de yongs su zin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de de lta bu shes rab dang thabs tshad med pa spong ba phun sum tshogs pa de yongs su zin pa la bya'o //
translated: refers to the fact that the awakening mind is completely embraced by such immeasurable wisdom and means and by the perfection of elimination.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'das pa dang zhes pa yang de lta bu'i shes rab dang thabs tshad med pa dang ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba las 'das te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'das pa dang zhes pa yang de lta bu'i shes rab dang thabs tshad med pa dang ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba las 'das te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is utterly beyond the levels of the hearers and solitary realizers‚Äù means that, because of possessing such immeasurable wisdom and means, one has gone beyond the views of the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: 'phags pa 'am de dag gi spyod yul ma yin pa la bya ste de yang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'am de dag gi spyod yul ma yin pa la bya ste de yang spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is not the domain of the noble ones, or of those who are not noble.

original: lha dang lha ma yin dang 'jig rten du bcas pas phyag byas pa /
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin dang 'jig rten du bcas pas phyag byas pa /
translated: It is worshipped by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang dbang po dang nye ba'i dbang po la sogs pas phyag byas zhes pa ni /
translated: It is worshipped by Indra, Brahma, the lords, and the lesser lords.

original: de lta bu'i 'jig rten gyi dbang po la sogs pa sems can mthu can rnams kyis mchod cing phyag byas pa'i mthu dang ldan pas mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'jig rten gyi dbang po la sogs pa sems can mthu can rnams kyis mchod cing phyag byas pa'i mthu dang ldan pas mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the power of being worshipped and revered by powerful beings such as the lords of the world, because it possesses the power of those who have attained such great qualities and miracles.

original: byang chub kyi sems de gzugs med pa la ji ltar de dag gis phyag bya zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de gzugs med pa la ji ltar de dag gis phyag bya zhe na /
translated: How can that formless bodhicitta be worshipped by them?

original: gzugs med kyang de yon tan dang rdzu 'phrul chen po de dag thob nas 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med kyang de yon tan dang rdzu 'phrul chen po de dag thob nas 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though it is formless, they attain those great qualities and miracles and bow down to it in homage.

original: yang de lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal ba la @95b yang bya'o //
analyzed: yang de lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal ba la @95b yang bya'o //
translated: And those who have such a mind should also be worshipped.

original: 'di lta ste stong pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste stong pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med de /
translated: Thus, the so-called ‚Äúnature of emptiness‚Äù is the thought of awakening, which is devoid of the nature of grasped and grasper.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra bas stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra bas stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Since it is like space, it is the nature of emptiness.

original: rdzas ma yin zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: rdzas ma yin zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúNot a substance‚Äù means that since it is the nature of emptiness, it is not the nature of a substance such as an atom.

original: ; mtshan ma med ces pa ni mu stegs can la sogs pas brtags te bdag la sogs pa khams gsum thams cad skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chub kyi sems de la nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ; mtshan ma med ces pa ni mu stegs can la sogs pas brtags te bdag la sogs pa khams gsum thams cad skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chub kyi sems de la nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSignless‚Äù means that it is not the self and so on imagined by the tƒ´rthikas and so on, which is the cause of the arising and disintegration of the entire three realms.

original: mtshan nyid ma yin zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma yin zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot a characteristic‚Äù means the thought of awakening.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa ji bzhin pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa ji bzhin pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a characteristic such as blue, yellow, and so on.

original: 'phro ba las shin tu 'das pa zhes pa ni 'phro ba ni rnam par rtog pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'phro ba las shin tu 'das pa zhes pa ni 'phro ba ni rnam par rtog pa la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTotally beyond proliferation‚Äù means that proliferation is taken to be discursive thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is nonconceptual.

original: nam mkha' ji bzhin tshad med pa zhes pa ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ji bzhin tshad med pa zhes pa ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is immeasurable like space means that, being without discursive thought in that way, it is like space.

original: nam mkha' ni tshad 'di tsam zhes dpag tu med de /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni tshad 'di tsam zhes dpag tu med de /
translated: Space is immeasurable, in that one cannot say that it is of this or that measure.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems de'i yon tan yang tshad gzung du med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems de'i yon tan yang tshad gzung du med pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the good qualities of that thought of awakening are immeasurable.

original: chos thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa zhes pa la /
translated: It is the basis of all phenomena means the following.

original: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi chos la bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi chos la bya ste /
translated: All phenomena are to be taken as conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos de rnams rdul phran gyi phyogs cha la sogs par bshig gam sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa'i tshul du bshig na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos de rnams rdul phran gyi phyogs cha la sogs par bshig gam sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa'i tshul du bshig na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur te /
translated: When those conditioned phenomena are destroyed by being reduced to particles and so on, or are destroyed by being like an illusion, a mirage, and so on, they become the nature of emptiness.

original: byang chub kyi sems de dang ro gcig pas chos de dag thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de dang ro gcig pas chos de dag thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is of one taste with that thought of awakening, it is said to be the basis of all those phenomena.

original: gnyis su ni chos thams cad ces bya ba ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi chos rnams byang chub kyi sems de la gnas pa na chos thams cad kyi gnas
analyzed: gnyis su ni chos thams cad ces bya ba ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi chos rnams byang chub kyi sems de la gnas pa na chos thams cad kyi gnas
translated: In the second case, all phenomena refers to the qualities of the Buddha Bhagavan such as the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses and the eighteen distinctive qualities.üîΩWhen they are present in that mind of enlightenment, it is the support of all phenomena.

original: su gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: su gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the second place, all dharmas means the qualities of the Buddha BhagavƒÅn, such as the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen special qualities. When they are present in that thought of enlightenment, it is said that it is the support of all dharmas.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Free from the compounded and the uncompounded means

original: 'dus ma byas dang bral ba ni sa dang po'i sems thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i gnyen por gyur pa rnams dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas dang bral ba ni sa dang po'i sems thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i gnyen por gyur pa rnams dang bral ba'o //

translated: The four investigations and the four kinds of thorough knowledgeüîΩThe four investigations are the investigation of the meaning, the investigation of the attributes, the investigation of the principles and the investigation of the accomplishment of complete knowledge.üîΩThe four kinds of thorough knowledge are the thorough knowledge of phenomena, the thorough knowledge of the meaning, the thorough knowledge of language and the thorough knowledge of eloquence.

original: de bzhin du sems can gzhan rnams kyang bsdu ba rnam bzhi'i sgo nas bsdus te spyod du gzung do //üîΩde la rab tu dga' ba'i yon tan sems dga' bzhin du chos dang zang zing gis pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa la bdag kyang spyod la /

analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams kyang bsdu ba rnam bzhi'i sgo nas bsdus shing spyod par gzud do //

translated: On the third ground, the luminous, one practices the perfection of patience with respect to unborn phenomena.üîΩOn the fourth ground, the radiant, one practices the perfection of effort.

original: sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can la ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas spyod pa dang / sa lnga pa shin tu rgyal ba nas bdud la sogs pa las shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /

original: sa drug pa mngon du bya ba la shes rab mngon du gyur bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / sa bdun pa ring du song ba la sems can rnams smin pa dang bol bar byed pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /

translated: On the seventh level, that of Gone Far Beyond, they practice the transcendent perfection of skillful means, for they bring beings to full maturity and liberation.üîΩOn the eighth level, that of Immutable, they practice the transcendent perfection of aspiration, for having attained this level through the power of aspiration, they attain the status of a master.

original: sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba la smon lam gyi dbang gis thob nas bla ma rnams thob pa'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa dang / sa dgu pa dag pa'i blo gros la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod @97a * //

translated: On the ninth level, that of Perfect Intellect, they practice the transcendent perfection of strength.

original: pa dang / sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin la phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mngon sum du ye shes kyis chos 'dri zhing spyod yul du gyur pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa rnams mos pa spyod pa'i tshe nyid na bdag kyang spyod pa
analyzed: pa dang / sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin la phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mngon sum du ye shes kyis chos 'dri zhing spyod yul du gyur pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa rnams mos pa spyod pa'i tshe nyid na bdag kyang spyod pa
translated: And on the tenth ground Cloud of Dharma, the bodhisattva directly questions the tathagatas of the ten directions about the Dharma and, in terms of the perfection of wisdom, he engages in the conduct of wisdom that is the domain of the bodhisattvas on the grounds of engagement through belief.

original: la goms par byed la /
analyzed: la goms par byed la /

analyzed: sems can rnams kyang bsdu ba rnam bzhi'i sgo nas bsdus te spyod du 'jug pa'o //
translated: And he engages in the conduct of gathering sentient beings through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: bsdu ba rnam bzhi po zhes pa ni sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don byed pa dang / don mthun par byed pa'i sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod du 'dzud pa'o //

translated: The four means of gathering disciples are to engage in the conduct of the perfections through generosity, through speaking pleasantly, through purposeful activity and through being consistent.

analyzed: sa de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / yon tan rgya cher ni sa bcu'i mdo sde la sogs par blta'o //
translated: The characteristics and qualities of these grounds should be studied in detail in the sutra of the ten grounds and so forth.

original: mnyam med shin tu mos pa'i sa //
analyzed: mnyam med shin tu mos pa'i sa //
translated: The ground of engagement through beliefüîΩis the first of the ten grounds of bodhisattvas.

original: zhes pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa de 'jig rten pa phal rnams dang mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa de 'jig rten pa phal rnams dang mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of devoted interest, which is not the same as that of ordinary people.

original: tshad med pa zhes pa de'i yon tan spyi grangs bcal ba las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa zhes pa de'i yon tan spyi grangs bcal ba las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable, in that it is beyond calculation in terms of its general qualities.

original: bsam yas zhes pa ni sems kyis bsams shing dpag pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bsam yas zhes pa ni sems kyis bsams shing dpag pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable, in that it is beyond the imagination and speculation of the ordinary mind.

original: sa bcu rim par thob ces pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po spyod pa'i sems kyi rim pa la bya'o //üîΩtshad med ye shes las byung ba //
analyzed: sa bcu rim par thob ces pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po spyod pa'i sems kyi rim pa la bya'o // tshad med ye shes las byung ba //
translated: It is the attainment of the ten stages in sequence, in that it is the sequence of the mind engaged in the practice of the ten transcendent perfections.

original: zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med pa'o //
translated: It is the source of immeasurable gnosis, in that it is the immeasurable gnosis of omniscience.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa de la bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa de la bya'o //
translated: This is the stage of devoted interest.üîΩThe attainment of all those stages is the attainment of whatever stage of devoted interest is being taught.

original: de'i sa thams cad thob pa ni de'i sa cung zad gang gsungs pa'o zhes pa ni mos pa spyod pa des stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa'i chos rnams gang cung zad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de thams cad thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sa thams cad thob pa ni de'i sa cung zad gang gsungs pa'o zhes pa ni mos pa spyod pa des stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa'i chos rnams gang cung zad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de thams cad thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is to say that whatever qualities the Buddha has taught, such as the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses and the eighteen distinctive qualities, are all attained by that devoted interest.

original: de bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa ni shin tu mos pa'i sa zhes bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa ni shin tu mos pa'i sa zhes bya zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the level of omniscience is called the level of great interest.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos thams cad mos pas thos pas na /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos thams cad mos pas thos pas na /
translated: Thus, since all the dharmas of the Tathagata are heard through interest,

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa de thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa'i rgyu ste de bas na rgyu la 'bras bus bslan te /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa de thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa'i rgyu ste de bas na rgyu la 'bras bus bslan te /
translated: that level of interest and practice is the cause of the level of omniscience. Therefore, the cause is referred to by the effect.

original: gsungs pa des shin tu mos pa'i sa zhes kyang bya zhes pa'o //üîΩyid gzhungs bskal pa gcig gis ni //
analyzed: gsungs pa des shin tu mos pa'i sa zhes kyang bya zhes pa'o // yid gzhungs bskal pa gcig gis ni //
translated: It is also called the level of great interest.üîΩThe intelligent one passes beyond

original: sa las shin tu 'das par 'gyur //
analyzed: sa las shin tu 'das par 'gyur //
translated: the level in one eon.

original: zhes pa ni shes rab can gyis mos pa spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab can gyis mos pa spyod pa'i sa de bskal pa gcig gis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: This says that the wise one who practices with interest completes that level in one eon.

original: de'i bzhi cha gcig gi sa ni //
analyzed: de'i bzhi cha gcig gi sa ni //
translated: In one quarter of that

original: shin tu mos @97b pas kyang 'das zhes pa ni /
analyzed: shin tu mos @97b pas kyang 'das zhes pa ni /
translated: he also passes beyond the level of great interest.

original: bskal pa de'i bzhi cha gcig gis ni /
analyzed: bskal pa de'i bzhi cha gcig gis ni /
translated: In one quarter of that eon

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa chos bdag med par chud pa'i sa de las 'phar te /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa chos bdag med par chud pa'i sa de las 'phar te /
translated: he passes beyond that level of interest and practice, the level of understanding the selflessness of phenomena.

original: ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pa'i stegs su gyur pa'i chos la bdag med par yang spangs nas rang gi sems thog ma nas ma skyes ma byung bar bsgom pa la zhugs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sa la 'jug pa'i stegs su gyur pa'i chos la bdag med par yang spangs nas rang gi sems thog ma nas ma skyes ma byung bar bsgom pa la zhugs pa la bya'o //
translated: It is to be applied to the cultivation of one's own mind as originally unborn and non-arisen, having abandoned even the selflessness of phenomena which serves as a stepping stone to entering the stage of wisdom.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i rim pa dang yon tan de dag sngar mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bdag med pa la 'jug pa'i skabs su mi bshad par rab tu dga' ba'i sa bshad pa'i 'og tu ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i rim pa dang yon tan de dag sngar mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bdag med pa la 'jug pa'i skabs su mi bshad par rab tu dga' ba'i sa bshad pa'i 'og tu ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Why are those stages and qualities of the stage of devoted engagement not explained in the context of engaging in selflessness on the stage of devoted engagement, but rather are explained after the explanation of the stage of the joyous?

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i 'bras bu ste de ltar 'bras bu de ci 'dra bar shes nas de'i rgyu gang yin pa de gdod brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i 'bras bu ste de ltar 'bras bu de ci 'dra bar shes nas de'i rgyu gang yin pa de gdod brtag par bya ste /
translated: The stage of the joyous is the result of the stage of devoted engagement. Thus, having understood what that result is like, one should investigate what its cause is.

original: de bas na mos pa spyod pa'i sa de'i phyis bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na mos pa spyod pa'i sa de'i phyis bshad do //

analyzed: slob dpon du rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni lung thob cing dbang bskur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of completing the master are said to be obtaining the precepts and consecration.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the differentiation are the one who abides in the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de yang lus kyi yon tan dang / ngag gi yon tan dang yid kyi yon tan dang gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang lus kyi yon tan dang / ngag gi yon tan dang yid kyi yon tan dang gsum ste /
translated: Furthermore, there are three: the good qualities of the body, the good qualities of speech, and the good qualities of mind.

original: gar rigs par sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gar rigs par sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply them as appropriate.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems su song ba'i yid dang ldan zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams stong par 'jig par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems su song ba'i yid dang ldan zhes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams stong par 'jig par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Among them, ‚Äúendowed with a mind that has become the mind of enlightenment‚Äù means that one is endowed with the realization that the phenomena of the aggregates, constituents, sense spheres, and so forth are empty.

original: shes rab dang ldan zhes pa ni shes rab rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan zhes pa ni shes rab rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with wisdom‚Äù means that there are two kinds of wisdom:
